description:
I've used Amici's a couple times for lunch meetings at work, with orders ranging from 5 large pizzas to 15 large pizzas.  The most convenient thing about ordering is that it's all online, which makes the process a breeze.

I usually order a few days ahead of time and schedule delivery for 15-30 minutes before the meeting starts.  The pizza has always arrived on time, and it's always been hot, fresh, and delicious.

I usually order half vegetarian and half meat, and I've narrowed down my go-to options:
- Margherita (veg)
- Veggie (veg)
- Pesto (veg)
- Pollo (meat)
- Spicy Pepper Chicken (meat)
- Custom (Beef Meatball, Fresh Garlic, Sautéed Mushrooms)

My favorite out of the bunch is the custom beef meatball, with garlic and mushrooms.  The pizzas are a little on the pricey side, but it's hard to complain when they taste good and take the hassle out of a lunch order.
author: Nadeem A.

description:
This is a nice pizzeria..
It's an upscale pizzeria with a menu full of options..

I have to say, I do enjoy their pizza..Not quite New York pizza but it is as close to what you would get in NY..

You can taste the quality in their food as they use top quality product and ingredients..Great place to grab a quick bite before a "Giants game" if you're on the run or you decide to dine in..
author: Head Chef F.

description:
We had booked a reservation for a large party of about 12 for lunch with all my coworkers a couple of weeks ago.  When we arrived the restaurant was virtually empty, and they had not even bothered to set up the table.  The lunch rush started to arrive as we were getting ready to check out, and as the restaurant started to fill with people it was clear that this is the type of restaurant that cannot typically easily accommodate large parties during a rush.  I bet they were relieved to see us go so they could break up our table.

The food was ok, but nothing special.  We all shared several pizzas, salads, and beer.  Our server was really attentive and friendly, but overall I wouldn't rush to come back here.
author: Jessica F.

description:
I'm one of those people who likes the thin crust New York style pizza.

In fact Amicis is one of my favorites when it's done right.

I almost always get the Amicis combo that has the pepperoni, mushrooms, black olives, and bacon.

The thing is I said no olives and substitute it for sausage and no bacon substitute it for meatballs.

Um, this waiter was on some other planet because not only was it not busy but my pizza came out like the standard.

He didn't even substitute anything and I was left with the olives that I hate and bacon which I didn't want.

I wanted to send it back and when I told him he said it was be about half an hour and I had a meeting so I couldn't wait.

Love their pizza but this was a waiter problem so 3 stars for this place due to him.
author: Jack R.

description:
Their customer service is really friendly and there's plenty of seatings.  But they really could do better with the pizza.  We were out on a Friday night and craved pizza.  Yelp said Slice House closes at 10pm and we did uberx to go straight to slice house and for there at 9:50pm hoping to get one at least their last slice of pizza.  They were closed :(

Against my better judgement I suggested Amici's knowing how I was disappointed with them seven years ago.  We ordered an extra large combo to go for $40 and the pizza was soggy.  Like when you lift the slice, it would fall a part! I had to use a fork and knife to eat my pizza.  Even slice house pizza's which is world class good is only about $25.

We should have just gone to Safeway to get a frozen Dijorno pizza for $10 and wait the extra half hour to cook it up at home and it would have tasted WAY better than Amici's. Sorry Amici's but that's the last you'll see of me.
author: Bailey N.

description: Been to this location several times before a game or concert @ AT&T so I understand how busy they can get. Came last night and the experience was not as good as it's been in the past. We were handed menus to seat ourselves to the directed spot. Waited longer than usual to service, the bill, refills, etc. The food was good like usual but it's not great. The bathrooms needed some attendance which is not what I've normally experienced here. It's in a great location to the stadium and Caltrain so we will definitely be back before another event.
author: Amy D.

description:
I stopped here on a Saturday afternoon for lunch recently. The food was good, and the employees were efficient and friendly. We were seated as soon as we arrived. 

The menu was filled with good options for pizzas (20+ types), salads, and pastas. We ordered a salad, a pizza, and some breadsticks, and they all tasted great.

There was a little mishap with the size of the pizza we ordered: our waiter brought us a personal size when we wanted a medium. He quickly corrected the mistake by bringing us the right size (and letting us keep the smaller one). 

The restaurant has a great location within a block of AT&T Park, and it would be a great place to go before/after a game. It would also be a great place to go for a quick lunch, date, or for a family meal.
author: Kristin A.

description: Actually I voted not to go to this restaurant but I'm glad we did. Amici's really has there act down. We started with the pan roasted broccoli with garlic, some garlic bread sticks, flame roasted lemon chicken wings, and the artichoke panzanella salad. The salad was really the standout with lemon basil vinergerette-but everything was delicious. Of course we did have pizza as well-nice NY style but not as spectacular as the appetizers. Excellent service as well.  Will return next time I'm going to the ball park!
author: Matthew S.

description:
We went here on Saturday at 2:30pm and were seated within 5 minutes. The wait time for the food once we ordered was about 20 minutes, which was fast considering the place had a decent amount of people in the restaurant.  

We ordered the large spicy chicken pizza, which I thought was an average pizza. 

The cons of this place is the price for a large pizza was $33.75 for a pizza that was basic and not very satisfying for 3 people.
author: John A.

description:
We have been to Amici's  several times when we have been in the city for events at AT&T .
 My wife  who has several food allergies which makes it difficult to eat in restaurants was Abe to enjoy herself. Amici's manager  Tatiani? and Victor our waiter went out of their way to make our dinner a special occasion.  We plan on going back this weekend and  would recommend to all our friends.
author: DALE P.

description:
Pizza here is not bad, but nothing special. Thin slices like east coast style. It is definitely a restaurant trying to appeal to tourists and people that are around the giants stadium. 

Overall, I believe it is overpriced for the quality and how filling the food actually is. After spending a good amount of money on a pizza with my pop, we both left here still hungry and had to grab a burger afterwards. I'm not going back
author: Manny R.

description: I do have to agree that the service here is the bomb! But the food is dynamite!! Food tastes great.. we ordered the Manhattan clam pizza and the crust was crunchy and airy.. the flavor was on the spot, don't smell clamy at all.. we also ordered the four cheese lasagna with meat sauce.. the sauce was so ooyeee gooey delicious with stringy mozzarella cheese.. garlic bread sticks were crunchy and flavorful.. overall.. this place is bomb dot com!!! However, I left a star out because parking sucks! I know it's not their fault but we had a hard time looking for a parking space.. wish they would have a designated parking..
author: boua R.

description: My fiancé has eaten at least 50 four cheese meat lasagnas from here. She could eat one everyday... I love their pies. Pepperoni, sausage, olive and mushroom is my all time classic favorite. Plus they have fast delivery.
author: Josh G.

description: I like this restaurant, certainly my go to place when I crave pizza. They have good variety of pasta and soups too. And it's a pleasure to sit outside on a nice warm San Francisco day.
author: Christine M.

description: Came here to eat prior to game time. What's better than pizza, wings and a beer?!?! Ordered the Amici's Combo, lemon wings, an IPA on tap and cheesecake. The wings were surprisingly tasty. They come either mild, spicy, or atomic (if you DARE!). Wanted to see if the wings tasted good so mild was the preference. The pizza was piping hot and crispy. Must say, this was an enjoyable experience prior to seeing the Giants game. Definitely get those WINGS! Worth every penny
author: Martine D.

description:
Just like a neighborhood pie in NYC.

I grew up in Hawaii, but spent summers in the Bronx. Amichi's reminds me of the simple pizza I learned to love in Parkchester. This is not gentrified, fancy shmantsy pizza. Crust is chewy with a char-- not too thin, not too thick. The sauce is not too sweet. And the toppings are not overdone. We usually just go for a pepperoni or a Margarita. They have a nice variety of salads as well. And they deliver themselves -- not with an outside service. Usually within 45 minutes and always hot and fresh.
author: John C.

description:
For me this is the best pizza in town. Always delicious.  Always consistent. 

Very fast service also. Every single time. 

Sam Adams on draft all the time. 

Can't think of anything bad about this place. 

I'd give them 6 stars if I could.
author: Miguel L.

description:
Excellent. Quality ingredients, fair prices and really great service here at Amici's. The pizza is really great, the portions are big and the salads?, forget about it. They are excellent. The mustard dressing is great.

Plus, get the chicken wings. The are great!
author: Anthony D.

description:
This place is great. Nice atmosphere. Nice staff. Smells like a pizza parlor as soon as you walk in. I'm not a"take a pic of my food person " but I wish I was and I think I'm gonna start. Lol 
Pizza was delish. Cute baby pepperonis. Fettuccine Alfredo was nice and garlicky. Glad we stopped in.
author: Chris N.

description: The portions here are so small, can see a pick of the "bowl" of soup I ordered from here -  serving size was closer to a cup and especially when you factor in that they sent the container as two-thirds full. The garlic bread was tiny.
author: Jessie R.

description: I gave this place 3 stars for the food, but they really need to work on customer service.  I understand this place gets busy after a Giants game, but I shouldn't have to ask the server to place my order after waiting for 10 minutes. Then ask for my check after I asked about it when they gave us our meal. It just seems like the staff was inexperienced and didn't know how to handle a rush/busy restaurant...but it wasn't that busy an hour after the game. Definitely won't come back to this location after a baseball game.
author: Michelle R.

description:
We were watching the Warriors basketball game on TV on a Saturday night and saw SF Giants Bruce Bochy doing a commercial for this restaurant. Lol 

Anyway, we ordered a mini Spicy Pepper Chicken Pizza, a small Clam Sauce Linguini and a half order of Garlic Bread from Eat24 at around 7:10pm. The food arrived at 7:40pm. We are about 10 minute walk away from the restaurant. So the delivery time was perfect!

Now moving on to the food...ugh

Pizza: Even though it was a mini size, it felt more like a small from Pizza Hut. It was tasty but the crust was burnt!!! It was also cut awkwardly; 2 giant slices and 2 tiny slices. 

Linguini: The small size was just enough for one person. It was pretty oily and only the clams were seasoned. The linguini by itself was bland. 

Garlic Bread: Everyone, take a look at the pictures. It was totally burnt...front and back! This was $3.75! It's almost $1 per slice! Inedible! Pathetic! No quality control?!?!

The total for the order was around $40. It was totally not worth the money :( If it was't for the bad weather and that commercial, we would have gone to a restaurant and had something better. 

Unlike what was stated in the commercial, it was not a winning call!
author: Alice L.

description:
Amici's East Coast Pizzeria is a great place for families who enjoy flavorful Italian food! I tried the Siciliano pizza and the half order of garlic bread. The pizza was cooked to perfection! The toppings were the perfect ratio, the fresh roasted garlic on top was the best part! I enjoyed the garlic bread as well!

The restaurant is very busy but that didn't compromise our service, at all! Everyone was friendly and quick!

I can't wait to go back and try their pasta dishes!
author: Leilani L.

description:
We wandered in for a late lunch on Saturday afternoon, hoping to avoid the lunch rush. Our group of 3 was seated immediately with our server taking out drink order right away. 

Started with a garden salad, full size with sun-dried tomato dressing. All the veggies in the salad were really fresh and crisp! We didn't really care for the dressing, which kind of tasted more like a blended salsa. 

We ordered a large veggie pizza with roasted garlic and jalapeños instead of the mushrooms and olives.   The pizza came out really hot and absolutely delicious! The crust is thin and all the flavors worked so well together, creating the most mouth-watering combination! We easily polished off the large between the 3 girls. 

Overall a solid place for delicious pizza. The price point is sightly higher, about $32 for our large veggie pizza.. But when it's shared it's pretty reasonable. Recommend it if you're hankering for a good slice!
author: Mansi S.

description: This was my first time here.I took my daughter while waiting to go to giants game.Very good service food was good,shared the three meatballs and ordered medium pizza. We had a half cheese and half pepperoni,ham,sausage.my daughter loved the food as well as I all around great experience I will be returning.
author: Juanita M.

description:
They just started to use a delivery service Door Dash. Nobody told us this is the new process. They shared all of our contact info with them and for one order I received4 text messages.

I have been going to Amicis for 10 years but this is the last time I will order from them. 

There is absolutely no consideration for your private info. 

Now how the hell am I supposed to delete my info from Door Dash.  I just wanted pizza not having my private data to be shared with some random delivery service.
author: A. R.

description: My child is gluten free- intolerance can handle the cross contamination but can't eat gluten. We ordered a gluten free pizza and it came with gluten crust. Amici's then took over an hour to deliver the correct order without refunding us. With the increase in gluten free needs Amici's needs to step up.
author: Emma R.

description: Pretty disappointed in this place. Ive heard the hype for a long time. Finally had the time to check it out. And luckily the time to wait for the staff. The pizza wasnt great quality and over cooked. Ive gotten better from little ceasars. After we were done it took more than 30 minutes to get our bill and pay. (Costing another 6 bucks in the parking garage) if it was busy id understand but we were one of four groups in there at the time. Probably not going back!
author: Chris P.

description: Great pizza, who would think that potatoes were a good pizza topping. The service was pretty good, the waitress forgot our salad, but was friendly and efficient. It's pricy, but you can expect that from a place a block from the ball park. We will be going back again.
author: Andreas S.

description: We had stopped by for some pizza because we had passed by before the giants game and wanted to splurge on some great food before we make our 5 hour ride home but Oscar who had no patience to take our order said very rudely "good luck have fun" to the other employee (Henry) who respectfully apologized and tried to make the best of our visit. Hire more employees like Henry!
author: Gabriella F.

description:
The service is top notch
Super nice, attentive, careful 
Not sure who is the Manager but he or she did a good job recruiting and training folks
author: FOO D.

description:
The options are plentiful and the quality is quite good. Although you're not gonna get a 'gourmet' experience the pizza is consistently really good for the type of pizza it is.

Their delivery experience was also amazing! They were extremely helpful and the food arrived hot and fresh.
author: Naman G.

description:
Poor value.  I ordered a 'large' pizza (a 15-inch) Trentino.  It was $33.75.  I don't order pizza often, so I figured this would be enough for 4-5 people. Turns out a 15-inch pizza is good for 2 hungry folks.  The pizza was unremarkable.  In hindsight, paying this much for a pizza was a mistake.  The price might be a San Francisco thing, not sure.  

I also ordered an artichoke panzanella salad.  I ordered the 'family' size, the largest available.  It was $18.75.  It wasn't very big.  Good thing 3 of the 5 people in my group declined the salad.  It barely fed two of us.  Ingredients, like the pizza, were unremarkable. 

Overall: unremarkable food and very high prices.
author: Ted T.

description:
Over the last couple of years, this Amici's has not performed as well as it did when it first opened.  While the food is still excellent, the service has gone downhill.  

My wife & I came here yesterday after the Giants Race.  We finished on the early side, so the restaurant was not busy when we were seated.  But as the dining room filled up, our server seemed to forget about us, bringing our food out very slowly.  We ordered a salad and a pizza; the salad took over 15 minutes to arrive, and the pizza over 20 minutes after that.  The server never came over to check on us to see if we needed any drink refills, either.

The worst thing was that we were seated right near one of the 3 TVs in the place, all of them on different sports stations.  But none of them were on CSN Bay Area (the Giants TV channel).  Right before the game started, I flagged down our server and asked him if he could get the manager to change the TV to the Giants game.  He said he would... then promptly forgot.  We followed the Giants game on our phones.

Eventually, our server brought us the check.  It took him a while to collect my credit card, and didn't get it back for another 10 minutes.  I had to ask the manager to check on it, too.  We could have walked out without paying, and they probably wouldn't have noticed for another hour.

If you aren't in a hurry, the food at Amici's is great.  But don't bother coming to this location when it's busy (like before any Giants game or other event at AT&T Park).  With the Slice House a block away with cheaper prices and faster service (as well as a few more eateries opening up the last couple of years in the neighborhood), this Amici's is not worth the wait.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Went for the first time after fan fest this year. The restaurant was packed and people were lined up outside. I was pretty impressed considering there were 9 people in my party and we were sat inside after only 10 minutes. The weather was nice so we were fine waiting on the sidewalk. They have no waiting area inside. We ordered the margarita pizza and I had the Caesar salad. The food was very good but pretty pricey. Took awhile to get any refills and our waitress kept forgetting to bring our extra sides of dressing, but overall she was very friendly and sweet. I would return here for sure.
author: Stephanie I.

description: This place is amazing. A little pricey for a pizza joint, but the food has quality taste! The garlic sticks are killer also. Whenever I'm in the area, I stop by. Staff was very friendly and patient (we had 3 kids with us lol), and food came out very quickly. There was a small mix up with our pizza order, and they gave us a whole additional pizza for free to make up for the mistake, wow!
author: Cyrina Y.

description: We liked it was right by the ballpark we thought the pizza was OK we ordered a basil tomato we asked for fresh tomato the waiter was confused by the term so we told him not cooked tomato he was very nice he did get busy and we had to wait a bit for our check when he brought I went inside to see if the hostess could cash us out but the waiters carry their own bank so had to wait for him to take care of it if we eat their again I will make sure that I don't need change we have never eaten a new York pie I like a little more on my pie and yes it was a bit much for what you get but it is San Francisco so you expect to pay more than you think you should
author: Dawn A.

description: Not impressed at all. Does not remind me of the amiccis on the east coast. Ordered takeout, the Caesar salad came with no dressing but came with a lovely nasty side of what I could assume was anchovies and the menu said "upon request"... It was never requested.
author: Mama V.

description: What can I say, it's a guilty pleasure. The Amici's combo does the trick every time, which hopefully isn't very often!
author: Adam P.

description:
My friend and I stopped here for dinner on a Friday night.

We shared the Siciliano and the New Haven White Clam pizzas and an order of the garlic breadsticks. Both pizzas were pretty flavorful, though I thought the taste of clams didn't really fit well with the pizza.

It was very expensive for pizza -- came down to almost $40 after tax and tips.
author: Alvin W.

description: This location for sure 5 star, when going to a Giants game or Guns & Roses at ATT Park, this is our go to stop and Never disappoints! These NY style pies are delicious, we love the pesto with tomato sauce, and we always get the Caesar salad, they have one of the best dressings ever! Beer & wine selections are pretty top notch as well. People watching from the sidewalk patio is the bonus at this, the best Amici's location...now I just wish they would come to Sonoma Co!
author: Cindy W.

description: Really good pizza I happen to visit them on first trip out on the west coast coming from a "proud pizza snob"
author: Derryck A.

description:
This place is good!! A little expensive but hey, you live life once!

Thank you for making me a happy Jew with a sad wallet!
author: David F.

description:
After visiting Super Bowl City, we decided to take a stroll around the AT&T Park area before hitting up the train station.  After many random bar hopping stops, we were getting hungry and pizza just sounded awesome.  Already super hungry, anything would probably have tasted awesome, but I really think this place had some decent items.  

The only seating available was at the bar right in front of the counter.  It was cool watching them throw the dough up.  They have a LOT of dough.  It was a cool experience.  

Started with the lemon chicken wings and were absolutely blown away by them.  They were awesome!  

Pizza itself wasn't bad.  We got the cheese combo.  Crust on the bottom needs to be crispier.  Crust edges were good though.  Overall we were satisfied.  Can't stop thinking about those wings though.  

Good location in front of the park.  We'd come back.
author: Jeremy L.

description: I have been to Amici's many times before and enjoy the food. However the service this time was horrible. The waitress came one time to our table and that was at the end and that was to collect the plates. We did not get any refills or additional sauces we wanted to request with our meal. I had to waive my hand to just get her attention. At the end, we waited so long for her to close out our tab, when I waived my hand again to get the waitress attention, the hostess just grabbed the tab to take care of it. To top It off it was not even busy.
author: Allison K.

description: Food was decent. Service was shitty! Asked for a box when we got our food because we were in a hurry, didn't happen. We finally had to ask a different worker for a box and the check. They charged us the wrong amount and then just recharged us for a larger amount. This place ended up being an inconvenience and waste of time!
author: Tanya B.

description: Stopped here last week and had this great Kale & Sausage pizza. Connected to the free Wi-Fi and got a free desert. Got a coupon for tax day $10.40 for any medium pizza. Got the same pizza but a medium and added pepperoni. Delicious and with a large drink $16.95 and no charge for the extra pepperoni. Great deal on good food. Give it a try.
author: Vince C.

description: This place has good pizza and amazing customer service. They go out of their way to make the pizza exactly how you want it.
author: Alexandra H.

description: Food is great, but never order delivery as that part of business is highly flawed. Drivers won't deliver to units in condos, instead calling to "meet me on the street". And also drivers for delivery are often challenged in English, so working out problems are challenging.
author: David B.

description:
Good pizzas!  Crusts are not hard and not too fluffy!

A chain so great for company expense.  

Spacious seating area.  A lot of eateries on this one street to compete with.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Amici's has some really good pizza!

When I first came here and ordered the Siciliano pizza of which the waiter noted was his personal favorite. Now, it's also my personal favorite! They put pieces of broccoli on it, with the real star of the show being the garlic which isn't diced up, but rather placed on as cloves. I've tried many other selections of pizzas from here as well, but none have really matched up to the Siciliano.

The appetizers here are also a treat! I definitely recommend the garlic breadsticks.
The pastas are rather decent and generous in portion. I tried the fettuccine with pesto and clams and found it to be a bit on the heavy side in terms of sauce.

Last, but not least, I have to say that the service here is excellent! The servers are very friendly and ready with refills and such.
author: Joshua M.

description:
We stopped by for a quick snack. The waiter told us 5 minutes for a box pizza. We paid and ordered two. 20 minutes later no pizza. Asked how much longer?  The waiter tried to call then text, the manager.   The manager would not pick up. I went in and asked him why he would let his staff hang out to dry. No response, and he never came out to tell the other nine people waiting what the hold up was. 
We got our money back and left. 
If you promise something at least have the decency to respond if you can't make it happen.
author: doug l.

description: I recently changed my rating of this place.  If you eat in the restaurant it's much better than take out.  The food was great.  I'll be going here and there in the future.   Lasagna is good. In house pizza is good. The wait staff are very nice.  Gave a good tip.   Still have one star off for my poor delivery experience but they make up for it when you go to the place and eat.
author: Nick S.

description: Had a medium combo pizza delivered. Pizza was VERY average, dry and cheap ingredients (especially for $30). Will never order again. A frozen pizza would have been better.
author: Foodie Z.

description: I ordered 2 items. Chicken wings and mini pizza. Waitress only brought wings and then the check. She didn't remember the pizza. When I asked for it. She brought me small. It seems small is not the smallest. Then charged me more. What a mess!
author: Mete R.

description: We went to SF for the Lady Gaga concert last night and wanted to get dinner before. We went here and was seated right away. Everything went well, up until we got our food. I wanted fettuccine Alfredo with chicken, but didn't get the chicken. I brought it up to our server, who was very apologetic. He told me to start eating and he would bring me out a fresh plate with chicken. I told him he could just bring it on the side and it would be fine. He did and also offered a desert on the house. I declined, just because we had to go and it was a simple mistake. I then find out, when I got my receipt, my meal was discounted. I really wish I would've gotten our server's name, but I definitely appreciated the service.
author: Audrey E.

description:
I come here once in a while when I am in the area. Sometimes we eat here before the game. I like their individual size thin crusted New York pizza. It's thin but not soggy, just enough amount of crunch and cheese flavor. I tried their Fettuccini Alfredo and it was tasty too, but I don't eat alfredo any longer, trying to drop some weight.

Service here is usually pretty good, but not on a game days - it gets crazy here on the game days. They keep the place in good shape, clean bathrooms and good management. Parking is always a problem around here, don't even try to find parking on the game days when garages charge anywhere from $70 to $90 - just absurd. Public transit or uber is the way to get here when Giants are playing. But that's another subject :)
author: Jeff M.

description: The pizza here tasted great. Unfortunately, it was very expensive and the service was slower that expected for how many people were in the restaurant. I was very happy to find a place nearby that serves a clam pizza and I'd go back more frequently but roughly $33 dollars for a thin crust pizza is difficult to justify.
author: Mark W.

description: We were on our way to a Giants game and decided to stop by here. Service was very good. I had the margherita pizza and husband had spaghetti with meatballs. Both were tasty and not too pricey. Will likely eat here again.
author: Gigi Y.

description:
Went online to order, all delivery area maps are locked behind a google wall. Wtf? I go ahead and order online a medium pizza with pepperoni and pineapple. Total? $34.93

Yep that's right. 24.34 for a medium pizza and over $10 dollars worth of fees from "driver support" to hsco and a 6 dollar delivery fee. Unreal.
author: Jim M.

description: Can't beat the ambiance on the outside patio- especially after a Giants game. My family enjoyed a meal on the patio after a game and enjoyed people watching and enjoying the city views. We had two pizzas and a large pasta Alfredo and it was plenty for 5 adults. The pizza was really tasty and had a great crust. The kids enjoyed a nice selection of kids meals and our server was very a accommodating and patient with 4 kids. My son wanted to try this place because Bruce Bochy does the commercial and I am glad we did! For sure a stop next time after the game.
author: Francine B.

description: Amici's is our fave NY pizza in CA. Of course. The margherita is good too. We usually do one of each. And the manzanita salad and done. It's all about the thinness and the snap of the crust and Amici's has nailed it.
author: S Blair P.

description:
Not a bad place on a busy street a half block from ATT Park.  The pizza is ok not great, but better than the other choices in the neighborhood.  They have a limited delivery area, and parking around there really sucks.  They depend on the walk in traffic.  The people are nice, and they mean well, but the feeling is "my job is to help you, but I am less than enthusiastic to be here."  In other words, less than motivated to be there.  

I ordered off of the Yelp site, and if you are picking up food, that site was awesome, fast and easy, I would use this service again.  I say, give them a shot, just beware of days or Nights when the Giants are playing, this place does get packed, so give your self some extra time.

Ciao
author: Paul G.

description:
Really? A "hidden" surcharge of 4.85%? And sales tax on top of that? So what if the fine print in your menu states this surcharge will be added? Why not just build that into the price of the items on your menu for "the high cost of doing business..." instead of tricking people into thinking the price in the menu is what they'll pay? 
Too bad your business practices don't match the good pizzas you make.
author: Anita R.

description:
Overprice pizza! The crust is soggy. Portions is small, but I must admit the staff there is great.

K BYE!
author: Joyce P.

description:
I come here once in awhile before or after a Giant's game. I like the ambiance of the place and was told the New York crusted pizza is really good. I personally have liked all of the food I have tried here, but I do think it is a bit over priced and the few times I have been, the service was not the greatest (I am sure it was because they were busy due to customers because of the ball game).

Personally, I would recommend this place. I am sure it is a bit nicer on days there are not Giant's games, but the food is pretty good!
author: Umang P.

description:
Ordered take out at 530 for a pick up time of 6pm and the pizza was ready! I'm a first timer but was surprised at how fast they claim my pizza would be ready. 

We ordered the New haven white clam pizza and added on mushrooms, black olives, pesto sauce-- it was delicious! The portion size is small compared to other places but I like that its thin crusted and not bready. We were able to actually finish a large between 2 people and not feel grossly full afterwards. This was actually my first time ordering a clam pizza and it wont be my last!
author: Sarina A.

description:
GI patients rejoice! If you're currently on a FODMAP diet and have to cut out gluten, dairy, garlic and onions, you've found your spot for a decent pie.

They source their crusts from Mariposa bakery, which is some of the best in the city. On top of that, their margarita pizza can be made without tomato sauce, which much of the time is based with onions and garlic - olive oil is the substitute.

My most recent experience at this restaurant was great. While I ordered a couple pies to go, their service was courteous; and even after mis-ordering (I forgot daiya cheese), they redid the order without any hassle, and 10 minutes later I had two new pizzas :o)

We used to go to Extreme pizza and Patxi's for GF pizza, and now this is our goto spot.
author: Bryant C.

description: Very nice little Italian place right on King St! I took the family in for a meal and we all really enjoyed it. We had pizzas, salads and lasagna. We filled up on their delicious garlic bread before the meal came, so that was a mistake, but the bread was awesome! The pizzas were great, fresh dough, thin crust and packed with toppings. The salad was stellar and the serving size was big! I actually ordered the regular size lasagna and couldn't even finish it! Our waiter was friendly and attentive, he even took back one of the pizzas that had a wrong topping on it and had the chef cook us a new one. The only reason I'm not giving it 4 stars is the pricing. Sure we got plenty to eat, but the prices seem a bit higher than they should be for this type of food. I will go back...and maybe I'll skip the bread....or maybe I won't.
author: Scott H.

description:
Its been ages since I've been to Amici's, I'm thinking 6 years.  Once you have really really good pizza, its hard to try anything else.  I decided to try Amici's again after a Giant's game last Saturday.  I was expecting this place to be crazy packed, luckily we got there before the masses.  The place filled up quick.  

The things I liked and didn't like:

Like
1.) Great location
2.) Great service (fast to serve and accommodating)
3.) Price (reasonable)
4.) Thin crust

Didn't like
1.) The pizza was just so so. 

I had the margarita pizza.  The crust was overcooked and very tough, felt like eating a big chip, lol.  Imo, Pizza My Heart makes better pizza and in terms of an authentic New York style pizza, I would head to 212 New York Pizza, their pizza is to die for.
author: Mike M.

description: We've been hearing about Amici's on Giants TV broadcasts for years, and went here 3 hours before game time last Saturday.  Kinda expected to be underwhelmed, but guess what, it was a great experience!  We were seated promptly, the waiter showed up promptly, and we ordered an Amici's special w/ no sausage extra mushrooms.  Pizza showed up in 20 minutes, and it was AWESOME - super thin crunchy crust, good quantity of toppings, and yes even obviously extra mushrooms.  The manager/maître de was in my line of sight much of the time, and I saw him handle a couple of customers' needs quickly and in a friendly way.  Even the RR was clean and well stocked.  Thanks Bruce Bochy for making the commercial!
author: H D.

description: I ordered 2 pizzas for delivery and they were very delicious! I ordered the pizzas with the manager and made a special request and he was extremely kind and accommodated my request. I'm not from SF but when I come back I'll order from them again for sure!
author: Mar R.

description:
Wow possibly the worst pizza I've ever had. So thin and measly. The tomato sauce was a good balance of acidic and sweet I suppose. Cheese was like they sprinkled krafts on it. Pretty burnt. Def not east coast in any way. 

Pick up was only 10 min though!
author: Katie C.

description: If I could leave less than one star I would they mistreated us the manager Eduardo was absolutely absurd and disrespectful. I work at a bar and they didn't want to serve us we weren't  being disrespectful or behaving in any wrong way when we asked him why he didn't want to serve us he literally don't have any excuses only that he knew we had been drinking because I told the waiter when we areived  so there it goes. We left and never coming back 10 of us!
author: Vanessa K.

description: Best pizza I've had in the 15 years I've lived in California.  Service was excellent.  No pizza by the slice, just small/ personal pies, but GD delicious!
author: Francis T.

description:
If over-priced, burnt pizza that takes forever to be delivered is your thing, than please come here.

If it's not, please don't make the same mistake I did. I just spent $60 on two 17" pizzas that took 50 minutes to be delivered (when the phone operator told me that it would be 30 minutes). Speaking of ordering on the phone: it took 10 minutes. ...to order two pizzas.

Pictures posted of the burnt crust.
author: David R.

description: I sometimes frequent this place on my way to and from Giants games. It's hard to beat their gameday deal in expensive San Francisco: 2 slices of cheese or pepperoni for $4. BUT I have to say that this pizza chain skimps and rarely, if ever, leaves me feeling full. Amici's clearly is a quality pizza but I would appreciate it if they were a bit more liberal with their toppings. When you have a thin crust pizza, you need need to compensate volume elsewhere. This pizza does not. Whatever.
author: Sean J.

description: Very disappointed overall. Order mini pizza asked for no olives and they put double. Waiter never returned to check in on me. Had to take them off which took a lot of the cheese with it. I had to get up to ask for the check. Horrible experience for a $17 mini pizza.
author: james r.

description:
Delicious!
The Lasagna was obviously made fresh. Took a while to come out but it was well worth the wait. Found parking right away on a Friday night and our server was pleasant. Gave this place five stars for the delicious lasagna.
author: Anthony M.

description: Pizza is great- we had the NY (cheese ) and a Pepperoni.  The chicken Caesar was served in bowl that was too small for the portion and a little too wet with dressing, but still good! Definitely worth a visit!
author: Dina L.

description: Slow, expensive, and now no longer offering gluten free options. Expect to spend a lot of money for mediocre at best food.
author: Shannon Z.

description: Do not go here. Young long haired manager is an not smart at all. Lost out on a 10 people party because he has no clue on what customer service is. Waited 35 min for a table when the host told us 15 min. Then gave our table to another party that came in after us. Left. Took our money elsewhere.
author: Ty H.

description: Pizza was OK. Be sure to take out a second mortgage or just hope your kids get a scholarship to college since the bill adds up quick at this place.
author: Suresh D.

description:
I've ordered from here twice, and the food is good, but not brilliant. I've ordered the pesto linguine and the marinara pasta. The sauce usually tastes great, and the pasta is cooked just right. However, the price is not worth the amount of food you get.

Getting a large pasta will be enough for a single person, but no more. Family sized pastas (I got one for 4 people thinking it would be enough) are not even close to family size. After we ordered, we had to cook extra food because we were still hungry. To pay $30 for the small amount of pasta that Amici's provides definitely is not ideal.

Delivery is pretty slow. The first time I ordered from here, it took 45 minutes to arrive, while my second order took an hour. Given that I live about 15 minutes away in terms of walking distance, that was definitely longer than I expected.

Overall, I'd say the food is good, but all the other parts of Amici's fail to live up to the quality of the food.
author: John W.

description: Very nice waitress... pleasant smile. Helpful. Good sense of humor. The Lasagna - 4 cheese w/meat sauce is a mile high & delicious! Very filling. Had a Ceaser Salad size, small, more than adiquite & was delicious. Yes! Will eat here again.
author: Diane V.

description: I just got my pizza and my favorite part is burned :( it came in fast but I could have waited a bit longer if it wasn't burned.  The other part tastes ok I guess
author: Concepcion Q.

description: Good place to stop on game day. The selection of pizza choices is awesome. The seating is great. Good customer service as well. Not sure if you can the pizza into the ballpark but the quality of the pizza is what makes it a good selection. The other items on the menu are good as well. The pasta and the salads are both nice additions to your main meals as sides. If you're in the area stop by and have a bite to eat.
author: Robert F.

description: My partner literally order from here every weekend, and the usual "Margarita Pizza" which is the best margarita pizza ever!! He decided to try something new(I wish never did) and went w/ the Siciliano pizza...An hour later the large pizza, spinach salad, and garlic bread arrived. I was excited, I took a bite and literally cried. It was very bland. The broccoli wasn't cooked. I sooo disappointed, how do you only have 1 really good pizza!! Sad face
author: Lynton M.

description: We order the clam pizza everytime! Crispy, loaded with clams and bacon...such a winner. Their service is fast and every order is perfecto!
author: cathy r.

description:
(Delivery)

The pizza was a bit overpriced, but standard enough.  Same can be said for the garlic breadsticks.  But the $8 gnocchi with pesto was laughably terrible.  It's one thing to just taste bad, but it's another to come in this little cup that looks like it was half-eaten.  I HAD to take a picture, which also prompted this review.

Maybe it was my mistake to order any pasta (well, it was my GF's idea)... but after this, it's going to take me a long while to give their pizza another shot when there are so many alternatives around the corner.
author: Darius Y.

description: I give this 5 star review because of the service I received this evening. They delivered my order, and it was incorrect. I called to provide feedback, and the manager immediately and genuinely apologized. He sent out another order, and to my delight, included a piece of cheesecake. This may seem insignificant, but quite on the contrary, it made a bad situation extremely pleasant. It was an unexpected, kind gesture, and he should be commended! Nice job!
author: Tiffanie C.

description:
I go to plenty of Giants games but for some reason because of the bad reviews on yelp, we steer away from coming here. 

We came after the Reebok Spartan Race so it wasnt busy at all. We were seated right away and approached by our waiter quickly. We ordered a large (8 big slices)with half Amicis combo and half Milano pizza. With 3 adults we were full, satisfied and didn't have to take any to go. It was soooo deeelish I inhaled 2 slices quickly. 

I LOVED the MILANO pizza the best!!!!!! It was garlicky, flavorful, just the right amount of toppings and the crust ratio was perfect!!! My husband never eats crusts from pizzas and he devoured 4 slices with the crusts (he did just do the Spartan sprint). 

I would also like to add that their RANCH is the best I've ever had, NO JOKE!!! Can't explain it, you'll just have to try it. The waiter gave us all a little sauce bowl of ranch unlike other places that are stingy and give u a little heaping of it. I actually had to ask the waiter what brand it was, he said they made it there. Honestly if he's BS'n me i don't care, I believe him cuz it was That good. We were joking around about getting a bottle of it to go. (Or were we?!) 

My son ordered a kids cheese pizza and he usually doesn't have a big appetite but he ate all of it! 

Very pleased with the food and customer service! We will def be back on our next Giants game
author: Chrissie G.

description:
MEH!!! Overpriced pizza.
(3 stars)

No wonder this place seems to always be empty. NOW I KNOW WHY.

- FOOD, tasty but greasy (they don't service slices)
- PRICE, i say overpriced
- SERVICE, good - we were the only customers 
- AMBIANCE, clean 

You'd think when it comes to baseball season and football season, this place would pick up of hungry fans before/after the games. LIES. Everytime I walk by this place it seems to be always empty. Well, to avoid lines at other places my group of 12 were seated outside in the afternoon sunshine after watching the 49er playoff game in the area and happen to be the only customers. We though ordering about 3 large pizzas would satisfy us. We split the bill evenly and not sure if $12 per person was worth it. 

HEFFER STATUS.

MARGHERITA ($24.75) - Mozzarella, Tomatoes, Fresh Basil, and Olive Oil (Tomato Sauce Optional). This margherita pizza was actually very fresh and tasty. They can make a good margherita pizza.

PHILLY ($26.25) - Roasted Green Peppers, Caramelized Onions, and Choice of Hot or Mild Sausage. There weren't that many slices to go around and therefore I didn't get one. But it looked good from a distance however my friends said "its was aiight".

MANHATTEN RED CLAM ($26.25) - Our special mix of Clams, Garlic, and Seasonings with Tomato Sauce. CLAM PIZZA?!?! i know, i've ordered it on several occassions at other pizza spots around the city. My friends were de-virginized and actually liked it. Don't be scared of it, it's usually good. However, I thought this place made it a little too "fishy". I think they add clam juice to it which makes the taste of the pizza a bit more clammy than it needs to be but it was still good. The pizza was extremely GREASY. Friends were complaining of indigestion/heartburn (we getting old!). 

ROOTBEER ($1.25/can) - half the crew needed carbination with their meal

Didn't see the bill but should have hit around $100 but we each paid $12 which equates to $144, so we obviously tipped our waiter pretty well over 40% for him to swing by and ask us "hows your pizza" and drop off our waters. Nothing special, the service was not special... just like their pizza NOTHING SPECIAL. I honestly do not think its worth coming here and spending all that money for average thin crust pizza. 

Will I be back? I'll try not to come back but i'm sure i'll be back since I'm always around SoMa/ballpark hanging out at the local restaurant and bars.

Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
I've only come here for take out and the service is great when we do take out. We ordered the Cesar Salad and Garden Salad - which were decent sized portions. For Pizza - we ordered the new haven white clam and amici's combo. The new haven white clam had a lot of clams on it - which is great if you love clams :)

I would definitely come here for lunch to check out their in-dining service.
author: Stacy H.

description: Service was really good. Our waiter was very attentive and quick. Their small personal pizza was perfect size for me, although some may think it's too small. Their Caesar salad had a little too much dressing. I prefer lightly dressed salads and for my lettuce to be really crisp and crunchy. Other than that, it's a great place for pizza. I recommend it and it's right across from AT&T park.
author: Alma H.

description: I love coming here. The food is so good and its conveniently located right up the street from AT&T Park. My family and I come here before Giants games and its never packed so its always a good time here with great food and good service. The servers can be a tad bit slow when coming to the table to take orders, but thats the only downside I can find. Love Amici's!
author: Leslie J.

description: The pizza is great but they take forever to deliver. If you go through eat24 half the time it takes over an hour. Tonight we placed an order and 40 minutes later we get a call from eat 24 stating they had a hard time getting through to the restaurant but that they had reached them and said it would be another 45 minutes until delivery. One hour and 20 minutes later we called the restaurant and they said they never received our order. Now we have to try to reach eat 24 to get a refund for an order that we were already charged for but never received. Oh and I am eating a peanut butter sandwich. Ridiculous.
author: Heather R.

description: My go to for a cheat meal! I crave this pizza it's so freaking good. I order the same thing every time large pepperoni and the spaghetti and meatballs! The food is very consistent and I'm never disappointed! I always do delivery and my food is always hot! Great authentic taste
author: Noel S.

description: These people are completely incompetent. Worst service I ever had. Ordered a pizza for delivery and the pie never got delivered. Horrible service. If you can go elsewhere.
author: Chris W.

description: Stopped here too get a meal before the ac/dc concert sat on the patio for 2 hours , good deal on a pitcher of beer. Chicken wings with lemon and cilantro was Amazing pizza was just okay. And I am from the east coast. Wish it wowed me. $20 for a small pizza should have
author: Kristin K.

description: This is a really nice place if you like pizza, it's not all the fluff of the California pizza places but is dam good pizza! The staff is adequate but the food is the friggin bomb!
author: Jamal B.

description: I have been eating at amicis for over a decade now and every time I have ordered the same thing. Generally I am quite happy with the service at amicis but there is something about the one on king street that just isn't quite right. Their customer service is not good. When I asked to have my bread toasted they said they don't have a toaster to do that when every time I've been there my bread has been toasted yet now that's impossible. I do wonder how they toast their pizzas without an oven that toasts it. Then I was told it was because they were too busy that I couldn't have my bread toasted. And to top it all off I was given the wrong order twice and apparently the manager whom I was supposed to speak to is helping in the kitchen where all my orders are coming out wrong.
author: Patricia M.

description: The pizza was a 2 or 3 compared to senores or a deep dish Pizza Hut but the fettuccine Alfredo was PERFECT. And I know my pastas. Best pasta I've had in the Bay Area so far ( cheese cake factory 2nd) 3.5 stars
author: Andre D.

description:
Disappointed in quality for amount of money paid.

The good points: Eggplant parm was quite good, mushroom soup also quite good.

However, the takeout container for the soup was only 2/3 full, which was a little disappointing.  Caesar salad was plain...and only one container of dressing was provided for two salads.  We had to ration the dressing, which probably contributed to the plain-ness.

So - to recap - a half eggplant parm, two salads with not enough dressing, and a partially filled "bowl" of mushroom soup came to $35 before tip.  

The food wasnt terrible, but it wasn't so great that I'll drop that kind of cash here again.  Please note that I have not tried the pizza, so I can not comment on that.
author: Nicole G.

description: I had to order food for a group of 8 and thought pizza would be the best way to go. I ordered off GrubHub (I know, I should have done eat24) and was expecting it to come in about 60-90 minutes but it arrived in about 30 minutes! I ordered 3 pizzas and a salad. I was pretty impressed. The food was warm, consistent and tasty. I personally think all pizza pretty much sucks in SF so its not to have a good go-to spot that delivers fast.
author: Farnaz K.

description: Pizza is pretty good, and we were lucky enough to have a great waiter, Wagner (might be incorrectly spelled) he was very nice and attentive.
author: Gus C.

description: I ordered the Milano pizza here, and the pizza itself was delicious. It had nice pieces of bacon in it, red onions, green onions, and potatoes (which is always my personal favorite for pizza toppings). I also ordered the pizza togo and everything was prepared promptly and deliciously. Service was also quick and friendly, and they were very attentive to my needs. I would say that the only downside to the food would be that the pizza is priced quite high for not a whole lot of pizza. I paid about $21 for a small size. Regardless, I'm still optimistic, and I will definitely like to come back to try their other options, but probably not as frequently since the pizza is more expensive compared to other options.
author: Daniel H.

description:
To add to my previous review...

Ordered delivery today.  Extremely quick.  The large extra thin crust pizza with meatball, pepperoni, and mushroom was excellent.  The large Caesar salad was delicious, with what seemed like homemade Caesar dressing and it was very crisp and fresh lettuce. 

Downside:

It was 40 dollars before tip for a large pizza and large salad... a bit high. 

BUT they get the 5 stars for being so quick.
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
I haven't eaten here in years, but I tried to order today through grubhub for delivery, and apperently they had different hours because of Easter. Grubhub called me 1 hour later (around the time that I was expecting the food) to tell me that they were closed and the food wasn't coming. I was pretty bummed out, but I ordered something else instead.

Then, about 3 hours later (when they opened), I got a call from (i'm assuming) the manager, to personally apologize for the mix up and the fact that the food was never delivered, and he gave me a credit for 1 large pizza. 

A+++ on customer service, and business style. I would most definitely come here again, order delivery, or recommend it to a friend. It is very clear that they care about their service and how they are being managed. Good job guys!!
author: Sami B.

description:
Amici's provides a good, stable pizza option throughout the Bay Area, and I have patronized their Lombard Street location (which was previously on Union St) for many years.  They are the best chain- local or national- in the Bay Area for sure.  This location near the stadium is an asset to the area- I have eaten here on a few occasions, had their pre-game slice boxes a few times, and also was treated to them handing out small free sample cheese slices recently after a game.  I will surely try to vulture those again in the future.

My only gripe is that Amici's is ridiculously expensive.  My last visit was $60 for a pitcher of Sierra Nevada and a customized 13" pizza with 3 toppings.  Really? It was great, I enjoy their charred thin crust, and I'll surely return.  But in the grand scheme of things this is a location (and a chain) which I eat at for convenience purposes ONLY. For a 'pizza night'- Tony's or Una Pizza Napoletana- MUCH better pizza and even better prices!
author: Andy S.

description:
Expensive for meh food. 

The cesar salad isn't as impressive as I remember. I had it at their San Mateo location and it was delish. I wasn't impressed with what they had. And at the price for a large?? Fuggetaboutit. 

The portions are small for what I paid for. Nothing spectacular about their lasagna.  

Just eat here before paying the same amount for crappy food at AT&T park
author: Liz A.

description:
We had Amici cater a recent office luncheon.  Their pizza is pretty good and I really enjoyed the thin coast.  Unfortunately, my co-workers would never settle for a traditional east coast pie - plain cheese.  So, I had to do battle with pesto pizza (not bad), butternut squash pizza (sounds weird but was delicious), Greek style pesto (yummy) and a Hawaiian pizza (goes against everything pizza stands for).

Their side salad was delicious and full of wonderful organic greens and a smattering of cherry tomatoes, olives, feta cheese and some other goodies.

Well-priced, delivered on time and was actually hot!

Not a bad choice and I'd definitely have it again.
author: .Hon H.

description:
They do not deliver to our house though they seem to deliver to other houses on our block. I'm not sure what their delivery criteria is but it doesn't make sense.

I've enjoyed the pizza in the restaurant but without delivery, it's not viable most times. Seems arbitrary and maybe even racist in their delivery policy.
author: Michael R.

description: Me and my roommate ordered from them and the food was excellent. Also they got it to us really fast. There was a bit of a problem with grubhub and our order got wrung up twice, and we got sooooo much food. They were really sweet though and made sure we weren't charged twice.
author: Meghan H.

description: Service and location are great.  Pizza is expensive but delicious.
author: Chris L.

description: AWESOME - now we're talking amazing pizza - delicious tasty amazing - this is the way pizza was meant to be - if you haven't tried it - you need to - best pizza in SF - and the wings are out of this world -- BRAVO
author: Phillip S.

description: My girlfriends are gluten free so we decided on getting the gluten free crust which I was hesitant about. G-free doesn't always taste right to me. Their gluten free crust was great! I couldn't even tell! Super crispy and flavorful! Very impressed!!
author: Lauren C.

description: Fast, tasty and consistent. Great delivery option and they have a great gluten free menu. The gluten free pizza is pretty good too (for being gluten free...)
author: Isaiah D.

description:
Great service and food!!!
Love some good pizza after a Giants game. This place is awesome
author: Carlos R.

description: Over-priced mediocre food. Ordered the margarita pizza which was really soggy. Our garlic bread was burnt to a crisp with black charred edges, and they had to the nerve to serve it. AVOID. I had better pizza at Little ceasers.
author: Harold H.

description:
Amici's isn't the best pizza I have had, but it is still pretty good. My son and I really enjoyed it before a Giant's game. I do think they are a bit pricy, so I don't eat at Amici's often. The one in San Jose is good as well (also very pricy).

All-in-all, good pizza for a high price. To be honest, I would give 3 1/2 stars, if Yelp allowed it. Since they don't, I was generous and rounded up.
author: Bill B.

description:
This review is long over due. I usually come here with my boyfriend and his friend after Giants games.
We always order caesar salad, Amici's Combo (pepperoni, bacon, sausage, olives and tomato sauce), and linguine with clams in a white wine sauce. Eveything is sooo good! 
Service is quick and staff is always friendly. I always look forward to eating here after the game.
author: Jeanie Ann D.

description:
Solid quality. Best chain in the city. You will pay. Sometimes the delivery really sucks.

I always get the combo.
author: Justin S.

description:
I used to get spaghetti here once a week (no pork in their meatballs).  Their pizza has always been pricey for what you get.

They are slow; they are expensive.  I haven't eaten here in a long time, because they can't be bothered to update with gluten free options, which every other branch has.
Pizza and Pasta and cross contamination standards would put this place back on the map for me.  Well, salads, too I suppose (but gluten free eaters are already going to go somewhere else for that).
I will say even if slow, service was generally attentive and generally involved a little more above and beyond.
Sure, even if they updated, I probably still couldn't get spaghetti and the meatballs have gluten, so no meatballs.  I would love to get some pizza and like Mariposa.  I'm impressed the other locations actually make a point to even avoid cross contamination.
Most of the competitors are too far away or have the cross contamination going on.
author: Denae W.

description:
Being close to AT&T Park is the only going for this place. I have ordered to go here several times on my way to a Giants game, and I have yet had a decent meal from them.

The pizza I had, didn't have enough toppings (very sparse) with a crust that was like slightly burnt cardboard.

Another time, I had ordered rigatoni in a white wine sauce with grilled chicken. It turned out to be linguini in oil with chicken jerkies!

Enough said, I will eat elsewhere when I go to the game from now on.
author: Tony L.

description:
First off, I'm going to address the pizza-shaped elephant in the room: the "burnt" crust.  The crust IS a bit darker than most of us pizza eaters might be accustomed.  Amici's explains on their website that because the pizza is brick oven cooked, the crust usually comes out darker (even blackened in spots) than non-brick oven cooked pizza.  Not to worry!  Overall, the pizza was absolutely delicious and the crust tasted great.  Amici's clearly uses fresh, quality ingredients; the pizza just looked gourmet.  Usually my wife and I order from Goat Hill Pizza, which is pretty damn good pizza.  And, when we find a pizza place we like we usually stick with it.  So, this was a big deal.  

Here's the not-so-great.  Two medium pizzas and an order of gnocchi (which was rather small) came to $65, which, to me, seemed a bit over priced.  Yet, with that said, I'll pay for quality food that tastes good.  Ya get what you pay for in this world.  Everyone knows the saying about pizza and sex, but I'd still rather have really good pizza.  

So, that's it.  That's my review.  Go to Amici's Pizza.  It's awesome and worth the money.
author: Richard T.

description: Yum! Really great pesto pizza!  As close to real New York pizza as I've had outside of New York!
author: Ingrid A.

description:
I have eaten here a few times and the food never disappoints it is always fresh and packed with flavor. 

Delivery orders are also prompt and usually earlier than anticipated.

Will keep coming back.
author: Sarah J.

description:
We've had really good luck with Amici's pizzas. They have a good selection of combos, and every one that we've tried has been delicious. Aside from being good pizza with high quality toppings and yummy, chewy crust, the pizza shows up on our front porch in less than 35 minutes -- every single time!!
Minus one star for removing the salsiccia pizza from their menu. Man, that was some kinda good pizza.
author: E. G.

description:
Ehhhh maybe I gave it a extra star because I ate it because I was really hungry but BLAHHHHHHHH.


This pizza is extremely greasy and soggy.
Trying to take a bite was impossible... it all just slid off like a slide.

and WOOOOH! talk about overuse of parmesan cheese. The pizza smelt like a mixture of baked vomit and toenail dirt.

But maybe i'm just weird about cheese....

Last but not least BURNT! BURNT! BURNT!

There was absolutely no love put in this pizza..... :(
author: Natalie B.

description:
It wasn't great, but it wasn't horrible. It's a decent option if you need something delivered nearby. The delivery was on time, and pizza and bread sticks were still nice and hot when I got them. 

I tried the margherita pizza, and garlic bread stix. edible..good if you're starving, but...I've definitely had better.
author: Tita Q.

description: Very good Greek Isle pizza and baked penne with eggplant. Thank you Vlad for your excellent and speedy service.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
My friend is such a huge Giants fan, she celebrated her birthday at the ballpark with a pizza party a few years ago. Apparently, you can have birthday parties at the park when the team is on the road. Geared for kids but a few adults have booked these parties for a chance to channel their inner child. 

The pizza was from Amici's across the street. Delivery was quick and we were soon devouring yummy pie. The thin crust was chewy and nicely blistered without being burnt. Loaded with lots of yummy toppings. 

Since then, I've eaten at the restaurant several times. Beware, quality suffers greatly when the Giants are in town. Don't eat here before a game. The hungry crowds overwhelm staff and you won't have a good dining experience. 

   3.5 stars for success of first meal
- 1 star for disappointment of all meals thereafter
--------------------------------------
= 2.5 stars final grade
author: Cece E.

description: Tried this restaurant twice to give them the benefit of the doubt.  Only ordered the dinner options Will never bother trying the pizza ! Overpriced small portions!  Terrible service !  Weeknight not crowded too bad for amici's !  We will not be back !  Did I say overpriced even for sf !  I would have given no stars if it was an option !
author: Jamie S.

description: Terrible service. Tried ordering delivery, after two hours with no food we called and they claimed to have not received the order even though they were able to charge my account for the meal that never came. Then when we told them we are cancelling the order they magically got the order in all of the sudden, two and half hours after initially ordering. Luckily I was able to get a refund but I would never suggest using these guys for delivery. Unprofessional
author: Dean P.

description: The employes are generous and very courteous. Food came out fast and it was better than expected. Our waiter got our order right. That is very rare for a pizza spot. Everything asked for was given to me. There very attentive they acknowledge your presence and overall my experience was fantastic.
author: Jessica S.

description: I have eaten here several times. The pizza is very good, crust is crunchy but not too dry, toppings are fresh and cooked just right. They use good sauce. The pizza slices doesn't fall apart like a NJ pizza. I would say this is the closest I've come to NY pizza anywhere outside of NY and I know because I grew up there. The service is also very good. Each time I was there the food was fresh, the restaurant was clean and the service on point. I still come back here when I get a chance even though I live on the other side of town now.
author: Hugh M.

description: A couple of friends and I came here for the first time last night. The pizza was delicious. We ordered the Margherita and the Trentino. The pizza was extremely delicious and the service was good. We definitely plan to go back.
author: Dani P.

description: Every time I come here at night (after 8pm), the place is usually DEAD & empty..the service is GREAT, & food always comes out perfect! Night time during the week is CLEARLY the best time to come here for an optimal NY style pizza experience!!
author: Denise F.

description:
After running the Giant 5k I was HUNGRY! I decided I would make it my cheat meal and have pizza. My boyfriend & I had never been here and were pretty excited. We ordered a Medium half pepperoni & half margarita pizza, that we absolutely LOVED! It was perfect. However, the service sucked! It took absolutely FOREVER to get the check. By forever I mean 15+ min and another 15+ to get our card back. We literally sat there waiting... These guys were literally running around trying to get to everyone (they were supper busy) so I understand but I just feel they should've had more staff. 
It's a great cheap place to go to, just don't go when it's busy!
author: arleene c.

description: My mother and I visited Amici's for a very late lunch. I think it was almost 3pm. I had a mini margherita pizza and my mom got the meatball sandwich. Since we didn't have a thing to eat since breakfast, we inhaled our food. The meatball sammie was delish, and the margherita pizza was yum! I could've probably eaten another mini. Our server was very attentive and nice.
author: Claudine D.

description: For a small one topping pizza it was like $17 with tax.  Yikes! The pizza was good and all but its just not worth that much for a small thin crust pie.  Oh, and the lady who took my order, wasn't the friendliest to boot.
author: Scott M.

description: Extremely expensive. And all I got was a flavorless garlic bread and burnt pizza (added a pic). Would have returned had I not carried out out for togo.
author: Anirudh R.

description: Good food and s great place to grab a pizza and pint before the game. I would surely return.
author: Kristine F.

description:
They have great service, you can call ahead and order to-go, or have your pizza start cooking before you arrive to eat-in!

They also have vegan pizza, and it's really good!!! They use Cheezly and it's way better than you'd expect.
author: Nikki H.

description:
So the pizza they delivered was totally burned. (See uploaded photo.) 

Called the shop and the first woman who answered the phone, as well as the manager said that they are known for their "well-done" crusts. I explained that blackened crust (see photo!) is NOT "well-done." The manager persisted in his belief that I had received a well-done pizza. Finally he agreed to send another pie out. It arrived only 1/2 burned.  I sent the burned pie back and felt badly that I didn't tip the second driver. 

Bummed that our dinner was delayed by 40 minutes and there was no offer to compensate for that. I called the shop back after the new pizza arrived and explained that I was disappointed that they were so defensive when I suggested the pizza was burned, and that they should reconsider how they treat customers. I told him I would be posting a photo and review on Yelp so he could see the crust for himself.  Manager said he told the driver I could keep the other pizza. Why the hell-o-kitty would I want to keep a burned pizza(?) I asked him. He then offered to put a "free" dessert on my account for "next time." I said there wouldn't be a "next time." He then offered to put a free large-sized pizza on my account for "next time."

Too little too late. There will never be a "next time." Arrivederci, Amici's!
author: Jen L.

description: Our server was kind and always had a smile on his face. Our two pizzas (margarita and Amici combo) were cooked to perfection! Come here for good pizza in San Fran!
author: Alex C.

description: Came here after an event at AT&T Park with a group of friends. The service was ok, but rather dull. Our waiter didn't check up on our group after we got our pizza, so we had to ask for water a few times. Not a deal-breaker, but it is what it is. The pizza was pretty tasty and it sure beat waiting in line at Umami Burger.
author: Nate W.

description:
Antipasto Salad ($16.75): Meh. Not good.... The tiny pieces of bread in the salad was very stale.

Spicy Pepper Chicken: This was ok, not great and it was no spicy for anyone at my table. Chicken was dry.

Trentino: SALTY AS HECK! I would not recommend this, I had to drink the huge cup of water they gave me and it was torture waiting for the waiter to refill my water glass. He didn't refill it till AFTER we got our check! TORTURE!

Medium for 1/2 and 1/2 is $23.95. Overall, really not worth coming here for any food. I would just call another pizza place and have them deliver it to my office.
author: Erica T.

description:
A-OK is the perfect way to describe this restaurant.

Good for pizza, pasta, or salad in the SOMA area - the taste is pretty good but the prices are kind of high.  Portions are also pretty small.  I've tried the caesar salad, spaghetti, and various types of pizza.  Definitely wouldn't come here outside of work hours, but is pretty good to satisfy the occasional pizza craving.
author: Adele Z.

description:
Given a choice between "Meh. I've experienced better" (2 star rating) and "Eek! Methinks not" (1 star rating) the choice was clear.

Utter crap pizza.  And while I am NOT an east coast pizza snob, it bugged me that there were Red Sox and Celtics photos in the restaurant, as they were obviously trying to make a connection b/w them and Boston, and let me tell you the pizza at Amici's DOESN'T even BEGIN to come close.  Just let it go will ya?  Just call yourself SAN FRANCISCO pizza instead of trying to live up to high expectations.

Ok - what sucked about the margherita pizza:
SALTY CHEESE.  And TOO much of it.
TASTE LIKE CANNED TOMATOES
CHARGED $1.30 FOR EXTRA BASIL WTFUCKERY!!!!! (see pic of receipt I shit you not)
SOGGY CRUST (making it REALLY hard to chew)

What happened to using fresh mozza and fresh tomatoes?? Is that too much to expect when I pay $24/pie?  And you have a BRICK FUCKING OVEN.  WHY IS THE CRUST SOGGY.

If you look at my other reviews, I don't usually rate so low.  But this experience was so disappointing.

$53 for a soggy pie (no meat even!), 1 Arnold Palmer, 1 glass of warm wine.  Yup you just lost my business forever.
author: s m.

description: Amici's you hear the commercials and you think, must be great pizza, this is a far cry from Zachary's for sure.  The pizza served up with a meat type combo, the first pizza came out with burnt crust which was rejected promptly, I can't eat burnt pizza crust, so we waited for another pizza and sipped on the beer until another pizza arrived. He pizza was good, nothing that sets it apart from any other pizza parlor... You have Zacharys, California Pizza Kitchen and Paxtis'  this does not rise to that level at all. They have a great location across from AT&T park, however I can't say this is a top of the line pizza place.
author: Wil G.

description:
While some may argue that a dripping greasy slice is the greatest, I on the other hand can't say the same. Their pizza is OILY and it becomes apparent just how oily when you take it out of the fridge the next day to a thick, white solidified layer of grease on top of the cheese. I don't mind pizza the next day but this one was not appealing and I was immediately turned off by the sight.

Regardless we'll probably still order from Amici's for delivery every now and again when ordering for a group. Due to the horrible phone etiquette of one unnamed SoMa pizza establishment I'm sure we will beckon one of Amicis pies when the hubs and I are too lazy to cook and are all fresh out of ideas on where to go out for a quick dinner or lunch. I'm sure that day will be sooner than later. Probably a bit sooner than my arteries would prefer....
author: Esther A.

description: Great pizza and service in the restaurant. Also, good beer selection. Worth going to before a Giants' game for sure.
author: Dan S.

description: Awesome food!!! It was right before the Giants game and they were very busy. The manger said our dinner was on the house for waiting so long. Very pleasant experience.
author: Amanda M.

description: I wanted to like this place. It's a nice looking place. The service was very good, but... I didn't really like their pizza. For me, it was a little on the bland side. However, I not a fan of traditional NY pizza.
author: Michael S.

description: Not very impressed. Pizza was mediocre and way, way over priced..the burnt taste of the crust in my mouth is not the way to enjoy pizza, at least not for me. the spicy Buffalo wings were well seasoned and were a hit at our table but the arugula/strawberry "salad"...wtf?!...they are def attracting Giants fans cuz it was packed with them when we ate there yesterday and when you are hungry, you'll eat anything at any price. Service was non-existent - i wondered how our waiter even got the gig in the 1st place. If you MUST go...just order from the daily specials list, your wallet might thank you. Being from Brooklyn i was hoping this place would wow me. HA! Fat chance.
author: Raffaele S.

description:
Always a good slice of pie - and conveniently placed next to the ball park. 

I never was a big proponent of their pasta, but we sat next to a couple eating spaghetti an meatballs I will have to try some day.
author: Sam A.

description:
Amici delivery for 25 PLEASE ! 

Lunch delivery was prompt which is always a plus ,  
We had a mix of Pizza, Salads, Pastas, and some Fresh Hot Rolls ,  
The Pizza was okay, but found it to have to much Corn Meal in the crust, but did like the Bake, and the Toppings.
Pastas for me were mixed, did like the Linguini with White Clam Sauce, it had just enough Garlic, the pasta though made with Penne did not travel as well and had a gummy texture.

For an Office Lunch, I think the Pizzas are a good choice, and pricing is average for San Francisco.
The Pasta though I would pass on if you need it delivered which is much more miss then hit, and if this is for home delivery it could be easily perceived as heavily over priced.
Salad was okay for what it was.

So for Home or Office I would say stick to the Pizza and Salad, Also , know that if you do not like a Dark Crust , make sure Amici knows that at the time you order since they bake their pizzas in a very hot oven and you can ask for a lightly baked crust, this was not an issue for me but it could be for others.
author: Joseph A.

description: This was the very first Amici's I've been to. I went for my mom's birthday back in 2008 and I am addicted! I always get the New Haven White Clam pizza which was the very first pizza I tried here. Soooo amazing. I honestly could finish the whole pizza because it is that good. I could never live without Amici's! Yum!
author: Celina L.

description: The King Street location is convenient, which probably explains why I gave them another chance.  This is now the second time that they have charged me for items that were left out of the delivery.  When I've called to let them know, they offer to give me a credit off of a future order - the problem is, I've never received a credit, let alone a refund.  Until this place can start actually delivering what people order, I'd avoid them.
author: prior O.

description: The minestrone soup is actually very delicious. I also love their salads, especially the spinach with pine nuts and bacon. I don't care for the feta cheese but Im not big on feta, anyways. The price is up there so I do not go here as much as I would like. The Parmesan cheese is surprisingly higher quality than one would expect. I put the cheese in my soup and it melted all stringy like real cheese not processed powder. The ingredients are decent which drives the cost up. It cost me a lil over $20 for a large salad and cup of soup, however I added a side of grilled chicken for my salad of which i was too full to eat. The flavors of the recipes here do remind me of east coast Italian but not as heavy and rich. which I like. I would go here more often if it wasn't so expensive.
author: First L.

description: Such great food and nice service. The pizza I had was so fresh I left left feeling satisfied and full. Will absolutely come back
author: Sonya M.
