description: The pizza is pretty good.  The cheese must be aged, has a nice sharpness to it.  Crust is really good, a little burnt in spots, only adds to the flavor.  Guy on the phone was a perfect English speaker - and if you live in SF you know what a rare and beautiful thing that is.  Delivery was fast.  The biggest problem is the price.  3 one-topping medium pizzas - $73 delivered.  Wait...what?  WTF?!? $80 with tip for 3 damn smallish medium pizzas?  That's about 4x what the same meal would be for Domino's.  Granted, these pies are way better than Dominos, but still - shit, that's expensive.  Amici's isn't THAT great.  And to top it off, you are going to charge me almost $25 for a medium pizza that is more like a small, AND you are going to skimp on the toppings?  Really?  The extra-cheese had no detectable increase in the amount of cheese from the other two, and the sausage literally had maybe 10 pieces of sausage on the whole pie - 2- per slice.  That sucks.  Sorry Amicis- I can get pretty good pizza at 1/2 the price from SBC or Chico's in the area, and if I want high end, Goat Hill is expensive also, put doesn't cheap out on toppings.
author: Ken P.

description: Thank you to manger Eduardo and his staff.  We had my son's 30th Birthday on the patio here on Saturday 4/23/16.  They did a fabulous job.  The 2 waiters that were in charge of our large  party (30+ people) did an excellent job!!!  Our drinks were never empty and the food came out timely and always hot. Everything tasted great.  Everyone had a great time and it was easy to just walk over to the Giants game after our party. We will defintly come here again. Thank you again!
author: Sheryl R.

description: Came here before a ball game during one of our trips. Luckily we got seated quickly, but it was packed. Seems like all the SF fans go here before the game. Pizza came out quick, but nothing super exceptional about it. It was good. Much better than the food we could have expected in the park. But the price was up there. I guess being across from the ballpark has its perks. A better option than eating in the park, but nothing exceptional about the food.
author: Kristina and Raf V.

description: Sighhh.  I hate giving bad reviews, but this place just wasn't really good.  I ordered a Caesar salad though, so maybe their pizza is a lot better.  I think this is one of those places that is "cheaper" than other places in the area for people to grab something + go to the game.  The salad was just horrible.  Too much dressing, and for $14 for a large, the salad was not very big.
author: Jennifer L.

description: She "small" is enough to feed two! Great size and great ingredients. Also, I have dreams about the Caesar dressing that comes with the Caesar salad. I got everything delivered to my home and it was fast and hot. I live in DC and this is as close as you can get to east coast pizza on the west coast.
author: Katie C.

description:
I felt like pizza for a later dinner, and since Amici's was 5 minutes away from DK's condo, AND I originally thought it was pizza by the slice, but turns out it's a nice sit down restaurant. DK called in the order and they said it would be 15 minutes. We headed out right away anyway, since we had to stop by Safeway for coke float ingredients. 

The pizza was ready already, half mushroom, half something else with meat on it. We got a small and that was three slices each. The pizza was about $17, which seemed to be a bit on the pricey side, but it was decent for New York thin crust pizza in that area. Will go back if I ever have a craving for pizza, but won't go out of my way to go there, and won't miss it if I never go back.
author: Ming-Jou C.

description:
Very good thin crust pizza but a bit pricey IMO. Atmosphere is nice and service was average.  Our server had trouble getting the drink order straight...most of us ordered water (LOL). 

The Vacaville location is just as busy as the King St. location. I recommend giving them a try at least once. It's definitely a specialty type pizza when you're in the mood for one.
author: Mel T.

description:
I'm from New Jersey so I din't expect much but the pizza was a 6 on a scale of 1-10.

What I didn't like was the price! super expensive and delivery sucked. pizza arrived coldish and when I called to order they answerd quickly but the hold time was ridiculous.
author: David T.

description: This was a pretty miserable experience. $40 for one beer a kids pizza and 10 cheese raviolis. Worst than that, they sat as by the pizza warmer facing the wall. Servers were by us the whole time getting food for other tables. The worst experience. The people were rude, the food was overpriced and I couldn't believe that they have guests face the wall by the food bar for servers. What??
author: Erica J.

description:
It's ok pizza. Not the greatest NY style thin crust you ever had, but decent, especially if you eat it in the restaurant when it is nice and hot. A bit on the oily side, but hey what NY pizza isn't? 

If you do go grab the chicken caesar salad. It is delicious and the dressing is just a light, refreshing taste. The chicken is also quite good, moist and good flavor. Pastas are a bit on the bland side. 

Overall the place has a nice vibe and people are friendly. Overpriced though, so just an occasional place for me.
author: Dom L.

description:
Ate here once before a Giants game, and of course it was crowded, but not nearly as crowded as I would have thought. A friend and I only waited a couple minutes for a couple stools near the kitchen, which is plenty good enough.

The beer selection is good, though even with two people you might as well go for a pitcher. 

Though I've never really been a big fan of thin pizza, Amici's has pretty good pizza. You could smell every bit of the flavor even before it hits your lips.

The service was faster than I expected before a game, so I guess the employees have been well trained to handle the volume.

This is a great place for a pregame meal/drink, if you're not into some of the other places around the park.
author: Erik D.

description:
Had the pizza and pesto here. Not horribly bad, but for the price I was paying, I was expecting better. The pesto was cold... probably prepared way too early before the pizza was done. 

We came on a weeknight, not during baseball season either. The service was HORRIBLE. There were only two other tables in the restaurant besides ours... we barely saw our server.

Had to consistently ask for water refills, and when we did, the server was acting like we were intruding in on HER time. Ugh, give me a break. For a place that charges so much for their very average food, the service is absolutely horrible.

Everything in this area is ridiculously overpriced anyway, so I expected to pay more than I wanted... but the service was such a turn off. I'll never come back.
author: Sara K.

description: I got a cheese pizza for take out. $25 dollars was the total. I tipped the girl at the front in cash for really doing nothing but handing me the pizza. The next day I see an extra $4 dollar charge on my credit card. Wow
author: Jay L.

description: Not sure what the complaints are about - was perfectly tasty thin-crust style pizza. They deliver, but it was just as easy for me to walk from Mission Bay to pick it up. Looked like a nice place inside (wood fired oven, lots of seating), and it's close to Giants Stadium.
author: Joshua B.

description: Just ordered a"Clam & Garlic" pizza....does not taste like clams or Garlic...very disappointed!!
author: Katherine L.

description: We live in a two-unit building.  They deliver to our neighbor's apartment, but won't to ours.  They say it's out of their delivery area.  When we question it, they come up with other lame excuses.  Their pizza is too expensive anyway..  would much rather have goat hill.. which is a lot better.
author: mindy r.

description:
My friends and I shared a medium pizza (half vegetarian and the other half Amici's Combo).  That medium size was enough for us.
I had a cesaer salad.

Service was really good.

Would go back.
author: A M.

description:
Just grabbed a meatball sandwich over at Amici's for lunch today, and was nothing short of impressed with their hostess. So I'm Yelping as I'm eating to say that I haven't had such awesome, friendly service from any restaurant employee in ages after coming here to get an order to go.

Reddish hair and freckled hostess (I didn't get her name and don't keep receipts) Informed me of proper sandwich size for full versus half order, didn't pressure me to add a drink or anything else, gave me a glass of water to drink while I waited and made sure to include extra condiments of parmesan and chili flakes and a load of napkins for my gooey sandwich.

AND Amici's to-go bags are lined with foil, to keep the heat going and your food toasty. I know it's horrible for the environment, but my sandwich was perfectly melted and warm 10 minutes after I picked it up and got back to my office. 

Amici's = good to go
author: Alita M.

description:
I really like Amici's pizzas and salads, they are my favorite pizzas...and the New York Cheesecake is to die for...which is why the following hit me so hard. Amici's is really big enough to invest in this technology and get it right and the fact that they're not I find to be offensively dismissive of the customer experience.


So...I have to take a full 4 stars off for being online-inept, or just a tease. I would've given 4-5 stars otherwise.

DO NOT provide an "order online" option if it doesn't WORK.

I work in IT and if I could not figure out how to get items I wanted into a cart and BUY them, then it's too obscure or just broken. What's up with highlighting little hearts?! Cute, but how do I ORDER them? No "add to cart" or "add to order button"...clicking the cart logo got me nowhere...is there a secret handshake?

I ended up calling in the order but still feel irritated that I first had to waste 20 minutes figuring out that the online thing just wasn't going to work first.

Take it down, fix it, or buy an out-of-the-box shopping cart that uses standard conventions that people know how to use, Amici's!
author: M B.

description: If I could put a -  in front of the one star, that would be more suffice.  Quality does NOT match the price.  They consistently get orders, delivery times wrong, as my company I work for have placed numerous orders with us, and let's just say their accuracy ratio would be 1:5.  Would STRONGLY RECOMMEND ORDERING SOMEWHERE ELSE
author: Johnnie W.

description:
So I walk into the restaurant and at the counter there's a manager on the phone and a waitress.
She seats me doesn't ask if I want anything to drink and the manager is still on the phone. After about 15 minutes a Waiter Comes by the table
And asks if I've been helped Naturally I said no...
So he takes my order Which was a spinach salad and an order of meatballs and to drink I ordered a Diet Coke, in the meantime the manager still on the phone. I'm assuming he's a manager because he's on the phone , Then the food and Diet Coke arrive and the manager still on the phone..
So I'm eating my salad and I go to grab my Diet Coke the bottom falls out of the glass and there's Diet Coke all over me....
The waiter is eating and the manager is still on the phone....
So the buser And another waiter Move my food to another table and the manager still on the phone my waiters nowhere to be found so I get done eating my clothes  are soaking wet... And I had to go up and ask for the bill because the manager is still on the phone....
The food was good, the service sucks...
And I stiffed the waiter for the first time....
Never even got an apology....
Now the moral of the story I'm assuming that there's a general manager of that restaurant that's not paying attention to what his night managers doing "need I say more"
author: Ken S.

description:
It's actually been awhile since I've had Amici's pizza but it's by far some of the best thin crust New York style pizza I've had outside of actually being in NY!

I've only eaten in once and had delivery a few other times, but this is well worth the cost in my opinion. Ingredients are fresh the sauce is amazing and the crust... well... that's what you're ordering New York style for aren't you?

I like quite a few different pizza places in the city but this place is definitely at the top of the list!
author: Cassandra J.

description: They have a consistently excellently prepared menu.  My friends and I have never been disappointed.  The staff is, likewise, consistently excellent.  They deliver the deliciousness quickly, and vey politely.  They follow up just the right amount.  My glass is never empty until I leave!
author: Theodore M.

description:
Good food that costs a lot, but what can you expect for ball park area food?

We ordered a small size linguine and clams with chicken added since I was craving it before the game. It came out to $18. The chicken was tender, and there were good clam chunks inside. The small serving size is for individuals, but it was definitely smaller than other take out pasta dishes I've had (CPK, Pasta pomodoro, etc.). I was kind of sad that it cost so much for that, but I guess ballpark real estate can't be cheap.
author: Jen L.

description: Stupidly over priced menu. Quality is so so. Salads are gross, and they don't even serve them with bite size pieces of lettuce.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Surprised at the overall review scores especially the past couple months or so.  I've always thought Amici's is one of the better pizza chains around, esp. for NY-style.

Didn't know about this particular location until we were walking around the ballpark today.  The weather was gorgeous and since we had the little pup with us, we were looking for an outdoor joint for lunch.  Saw Amici's and we knew this was the place.

Thought about the vegetarian (which i've had and loved) or the vegan (which i'm dying to try) but settled on the red clam.  Perfectly made and the medium we got was huge!  Took home almost 1/2 of it to clean off at dinner.

Great location esp when the weather is good.  Would imagine its perfect to chow here before a ball-game or after.  Server was great.  Don't really know what inside is like but the sidewalk eating was very good -- lots of space as well as shade.  Will return if we're in the area, or even take out to go.
author: C R.

description:
Came here for some pizza.  Good thin crust.  Good service.  The pizza is just too greasy.  I'm talking about dripping off my pizza.  I get that all pizza has some grease, but when it's dripping off, its just too much. 

Also, they prices are no better if you buy a larger pizza.  Shouldn't they provide some sort of discount for a larger pizza?
author: Denis S.

description:
Running around San Francisco all day can be exhausting.  In fact, even though there are so many new and exciting eateries to check out there are some times you are too tired to get out there.  At the same time, you want PIZZA.  

Delivered.

Ok then, call Amici's.  They'll hook you right up.  I was thrilled when they said they'd deliver to our hotel. They took our credit card, too.  The menu i looked at online said they had oven roasted garlic as a topping and sauteed mushroom. Not sure why but I always picture "sauteed  mushrooms" as FRESH mushrooms. These were canned. I guess fresh was too difficult. The garlic was yummy and the mild italian sausage as OK.  

The only other thing I have to mention is the crust. We asked for the thin crust and indeed, got it.  But the menu specifically says, "If a darker crust is not to your liking, please specify "light crust", although the result may be undercooked for some tastes."  Now I don't know about YOU, but I really appreciate it when a restaurant brings this type of stuff up. It means they want you to know ahead of time something that might be a fault of theirs and remedy it.  So, as you've probably figured out by now, we went ahead and ordered the crust "LIGHT."

Never happened. The bottom of the pizza was black as the night.  Still tasted good, but still. Also there were those canned mushrooms. Of course we ate it. and it was GOOD.  Just stopped short of being FANTASTIC because of those little issues.

This place got an added star from me because they delivered and made my life easier that night.  Considering I've only tried their pizza, that's pretty generous of me. When we come back I wouldn't mind trying something else of theirs.
author: Deb M.

description:
I've been 6 times, always in the afternoon with a party of 2, and nearly always ordering the same thing: extra thin crust spicy chicken and pepper pizza. It's always perfectly cooked, tastes great, and arrives quickly. 

I'm a fan of basic places that can do a couple of things consistently well, so I'll be returning at least once a month, I'm sure.
author: Greg J.

description: Very confused by this location..... Tried to order delivery a few months ago told me they were expanding to my neighborhood. Couple weeks later they delivered to our house PERFECT!   Called tonight for delivery but they said they will not deliver after dark..... Its 5:15 pm and they will not deliver. Apparently Potrero Ave is to dangerous at 5:00pm
author: Jonathan S.

description: It's a good causual dining place if you have a group of people to feed. Service was good althoug it took awhile for our order to be served. The clam pizza in red sauce was really good!
author: Mimi T.

description:
I'll never be able to review Amicis because, frankly, I'll never eat their pizza. Placed a delivery order based on the fact they, hey, they deliver. Unfortunately, even though we're a five minute drive from the place, they don't deliver to our neighborhood (Dogpatch) because "we've been robbed a few times in your neighborhood and so we've stopped delivering there for the time."

Frankly, if you stop delivering to every neighborhood in SF that you might get robbed in you might want to consider moving to Fresno.
author: Michael R.

description:
i'll get straight to the point.....

Pros:
-- even after a sold out Giants game, i was able to get a table right away, and the food came with no delays.
-- the pizza is still good, although i'm not as enamored with it as i once was.  not sure why.

Cons:
-- 4.85% SF health surcharge, even though their prices are on the high side.

the 4.85% health surcharge is the reason why i'll never come back.  their pizza is good, but not so good that it justifies their premium prices AND the additional 4.85% rip off fee.  i'll just go elsewhere for pizza from now on.
author: Sheldon M.

description: They have to go pizza slices. 2 large slices for $5. They only have pepperoni and cheese slices. It was really greasy. Thin crust so it wasn't that filling. I got the cheese pizza. It kinda tasted like... A tomato pizza. The cheese would separate from the dough when I bit into it. The fact that it was to go made it convenient for the giants game.
author: Emily L.

description: Good East coast pizza in SF!  We are from Boston and know good pizza so we were thrilled to discover Amici's!  They don't have a ton of different items other than pizza which is a bit disappointing, but the pizza is great.  Quick delivery!
author: Erin D.

description: Let me preface this by saying I had takeout and didn't eat at Amici's.  I ordered a pizza and it wasn't good.  The crust was overly burned and it just wasn't a good pizza.  I was disappointed because of all the advertising about this east coast pizzeria.  The price for a medium plain cheese pizza was $21.00 this is way over priced.
author: The R.

description:
We were on our way to an event at AT&T. The wait staff are well versed in high volume turn arounds, and we were seated in a very crowded venue within 15 minutes after saying there would be a 30 minute wait. The salad and Greek Pizza were excellent, the beer cold, and service friendly!
Thank you Amici's for getting our evening off to a great start!
I gave it a four, because I haven't sampled enough of their menu, but I do like what I see!
author: Spring S.

description: Came here on a day trip to pick up tickets from clear channel which is down the block. we were hungry and i knew amici pizza was close by. we didnt have so much time so we decided to get some pizza. I always get the Boston which is my favorite. The BF ordered a combo which was good too. And we shared the Cesar salad. Would def come back here if I was in the neighborhood and needed to have some pizza. there was no wait cuz it was like 4:45 when we came service was good. I love their fresh Parmesan cheese and their mint!
author: Chan T.

description: I've gotta agree with most of the 1-star and 2-star reviewers here.   $10+ for what is a side dish of pasta, although they call it "Small."  The pasta was al dente and kept its firmness for takeout, which is why I am giving 2-star instead of 1-star.  IF I decide to go back for pizza, because I do like the "burnt" style pizza, and if it's good, I'll come back and reconsider the rating.
author: Merrick W.

description:
$36 for a small pasta dish and a medium pizza?!  Highway robbery I tell you.  

The food was only OK.  But service was great.  The folks here are super friendly and helpful.  Since it was early evening on a Sunday and not yet baseball season, parking was a breeze...
author: Christine P.

description:
I was pretty startled at my recent visit. I was one of the organizers for a group reunion and I had a fabulous meal at the Lombard Street location in the City and thought I might try the one near at&t Park for a change of environment. I was quite disappointed.

We got menus really quick and was kind of hurried to order. The waiter kept asking if we were ready but we kept requesting for more time. I'm not quite sure but I felt that she had something against us or wanted us out ASAP. Ordering wasn't too much of a hassle though. I was able to be flexible with swapping pastas. Normally I stick with the fettuccine Alfredo but I thought I would switch it up a bit with linguini. I was sharing with the co-host and ordered a large size. Little did I remember that ordering a large size was not even able to satisfy MY OWN appetite. I had to order another large pasta with vegetables, garlic, to share. I was hoping to keep the cost lower too as I was watching my budget for the holiday season. That didn't happen.

We had to keep asking for water refills since it wasn't protocol apparently. The wait time was pretty long and we did not order any appetizers. If you're hungry, consider ordering a pasta one size smaller than your appetite suggests and go with an appetizer (or two). A friend also ordered a pizza and it came out somewhat burnt and TINY for a personal size, sadly. 

Customer service really needs to get a huge upgrade, seriously. I don't want to dine in a facility that doesn't have a favorable impression towards its patrons. We did, however, get a friendly waitress to take a group photo for us so that was a plus. Other than that, not much going on.
author: Dominic T.

description: No stars. Pasta sucks!  Expensive too! Typical chain restaurant.
author: Fancy S.

description:
We've eaten at other Amici's restaurants and wanted a meal outside of the ballgame.  We knew what to expect for food/prices, but were surprised there was no gluten-free offering at this Amici's.  

I would have rated it 4 stars for this, except for the service of Darcey.  She went out of her way to be helpful, and understood the food allergy concerns our party was working to avoid.  Darcey made recommendations, noted the order thoroughly and even took personal responsibility to speak to the chef.  Then she even checked the food order to make sure it was safe.  She was a delight to work with and she alone deserved the five stars.  Maybe if she wouldn't have been there we would not have had as good of an experience like the other reviews, but I can only say good things about our experience.   

Our only request is they find a way to add gluten-free options at this location.  And, that they train their other personnel to live up to the same quality as Darcey provides!
author: J J.

description:
Fast talker? Type A? Left coast hater?....Your pizza's waiting.

It's not as if there is a goldmine of great places to dine reasonably in the Mission Bay area, especially within strolling distance of the N Judah. And for a chain pizza (albeit a small chain), Amici's East Coast does serve up really tasty, NY-style pizza the way they make it back there.

It was nearly empty on the evening of Valentine's Day as I guess pizza would be the kiss-of-death for any budding romance. My friend and I have no such problems, so we went for the garlic-infused Calabria pizza, which was layered with bits of crispy pancetta and tomato chunks over a meltdown of provolone and mozzarella. I think it's quite yummy. A 13-inch Medium is a bit over $16. I tried to offset it with a $3.95 Side Salad which I willingly allowed to be drowned in their Caesar dressing.

The service was most attentive but sometimes a strange bit of victim-speak would come out - when the waitress asked for our dirty plates, she said, "Is this mine to have, sir?"...uh, sure, now begone, young wench! There are certainly more elaborate pizzas in town, but between this place and the more trafficked Union Street locale, this pizza hits the spot.

FOOD - 4 stars...really good, thin-crust NY-style pizza if that's your pleasure
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...modern contempo, sure ain't homey...Mama Celeste is rolling over in her dough
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...attentive...but like yourself more
TOTAL - 4 stars...mainly for good pizza and the sparsity of alternatives in Mission Bay
author: Ed U.

description:
In the afternoon and when I listen to Sports-gossip on KNBR 680, sports talk host Ralph Barbieri, who happens to be also the spokesperson for Amici's Pizza, swear that Amici's Pizza is just as close as authentic to Italian as could be. And with him being a true Italian, I truly trust his judgment and maybe eat an Amici someday. 

Well, that day is "today" or "tonight" for that matter, when I just received another pair of tickets for the Giant's game. But this time, I got tickets from another co-worker and yes, better seats than my weekend bleacher section. I just happened to get off work late, so I went straight to the ballpark after work. 

And walking around the suddenly emerging area of China Basin/South Beach area, some of the nearby businesses have table(s) with quick snacks and/or drinks to take to the ballpark. Amici's pizzeria is one of them, and they have an employee with boxes of sliced pizza for sale. And I paid $3.00 for a slice of a small deep-crust cheese. It's not really a big slice like Blondie's, but fresher and thicker with the gooey melted cheese. For a guy who infrequently eats pizza, I thought that lone slice was ok.

Mr. Barbieri definitely knows what he is talking about with the pizza. But a true test, I definitely need to try more of their foods in the near future to really judge how the restaurant really is
author: Matt G.

description:
Housed along the burgeoning upgrades to SOMA and near the Giant's stadium, I love that this pizzeria exists within walking distance from Folsom Blvd.  A friend of mine had a sudden craving, so we walked out later in the evening, along the pier, and to this establishment.  A chain, yes I know, but I was starving!

Greeted by the host, who has a very thick accent but very warm and jovial.

I knew exactly what I wanted even before I had a chance to peruse the menu.  The Trentino Pizza, thin crunchy crust layered with toppings of sweet red onions, spinach, pancetta, parmesan, mozzarella, feta, and the olive oil drizzled all over was infused with lemon.   We requested that with an extra helping of garlic.  The host laughed and stated that no one would be kissable after that meal.

Other recommendations for the pizza would be the Calabria pizza, simple, no tomato sauce........and the spicy Pepper Chicken Pizza.  Spicy but tender pieces of chicken dot this gourmet pizza.

For a large, our tab was around $25, but we took the other half home with us.  Perfect meal and right thereafter, we took a walk along the pier and it was a very clear beautiful evening.
author: Miika M.

description:
Their pizzas are not really burnt that much, I think that it's just cooked in a dirty oven, so the bottoms of every pizza are soiled with the accumulated burnt flour. The taste of the pizza dough itself is very bland. Apparently a few co-workers from New York like this type of "dirty bottom pizzas". For my taste, it's not a favorite. In my opinion, the nearby South Beach Cafe serves better pizza (when done correctly) for less.

My only real beef with Amici's is that they don't know how to cook bacon. In both their Calabria pizza (pancetta) and the spinach salad, the bacon has been overcooked into crispy burned bits. I like bacon, I don't like burned bacon.

Pastas are okay, and the meatballs with marinara sauce are very good. The restaurant is nice and the service is pleasant. Prices are a bit expensive.

I ordered their garlic breadsticks once, with a pizza carryout order, but I think that they gave me the plain ones instead, because I couldn't see/taste or smell any of the garlic. They also seem to forget to add utensils and napkins (even though I asked for it, but I forgot to check the bag - my fault for not checking).

I do like their fancy packaging (foil lined bags for the breadsticks, and foil lined cardboard bottoms for paper bags with hot food). It's part of their good service.

Convenient Free delivery within downtown and other specific areas (see map):
http://www.waiter.com/wwwsys/amicis/amicis1.deliverymap.gif

If you're outside of their delivery area, there's a delivery charge with Waiter.com.
($8.95 delivery charge + $2 fuel surcharge + 15% driver support charge)
Wow! Those charges are too expensive, not worthwhile to order delivery outside their area!
author: Luis C.

description:
I came for dinner with a friend this past Friday before the Giants game. It's the first time on a while, so it's a chance to update my review.

We ordered the Amici's regular combo. It's the most conservative choice because it pretty much contains the basic toppings (like pepperoni, mushroom, etc.) that we all like.  The medium size was 13 inches, almost perfect for two people.  The crust was thin and flaky, a big plus for someone like me who dislike thick crusts. In fact, I'm not sure if there are other places there the crust stands out so much for being as good as the rest of the pizza.

The staff was pretty nice and attentive despite the pregame crowds. There's outside seating which we had a chance to enjoy that evening.

They do charge 4.85 percent tax due to the requirement for restaurant employee health insurance. I commented on it last time also but this tome I will not deduct for it. (I wonder if it's charged also at their other location in SF.)

Studying the menu, it's good to see they serve mini size also (seven inches). That means I can return to try on my own certain combos that my friend was not a fan of.
author: H K.

description:
Popped in while a Giants game was in session and the place was pretty empty.  That said, we were still seated at a small table in an awkward spot up against a wall just outside what appeared to be the kitchen or server station, surrounded by numerous windowside tables as well more private tables tucked away around the corner, only a few steps away.  

We placed our order for a veggie pizza with vegan cheese and a flavored Snapple Ice Tea.  We waited a good amount of time before our server came around to apologize for the delay as the kitchen had not received our order.  That delay actually kept us from beating the Giants crowd and in turn, delayed my evening plans.  In all fairness though, the server felt really bad about it, and the Snapple was on the house.  

The pizza was okay, but then we did request vegan cheese, which probably isn't the easiest to pull off.
author: Carol Y.

description:
I really love baseball. I love the Giants, Pacbell Park and the whole thing. The good news is that this Amici's is right next to the ballpark and in the same building as the garage I usually use. So they get two stars for location.

But it's just an Amici's pizza. Not bad but not amazing or even notable. I don't get it.
author: Brian B.

description:
Most chain pizza is bad.  Really, really bad.  So the bar is set pretty low for a place like Amici's that actually makes good pizza.  They make a good crust, it's not too greasy, and they've got some nice combinations if you're not creative enough to come up with new ideas yourself.  I like the vegetarian with carmelized onions.

Do I crave Amici's the way I crave Zachary's, Pauline's or Cheeseboard?  Nope.  But it's a great 2nd tier pizza, and I'll happily give them props for pulling it off as a chain.
author: Laurence W.

description: Had the clam pizza it was thin but very tasty!  A little bit on the expensive side though and the pizza was cut into way more than 8 pieces. I forgot the exact amount but it was definitely enough for 4 5 people to share.
author: Tim C.

description:
Free pizza is good pizza. How can I complain when I'm treated to pizza? 

On top of that, what goes better with beer and a late night programming session at work? ah, ive let out my secret -- yes i am a geek.

Despite that, amici's pizza was...unexciting. The slightly burnt bottom of the pizza kind of killed it for me. Other than that though, the pizza wasn't bad. Fairly thin crust comes standard, lots of toppings. It got the job done. And delivery on a Monday night was super quick! Really tho, nothing to bring me back.
author: Christine L.

description: This location does a great job of getting all of the Giant's fans that come to eat here in and out within a reasonable time. I came here for dinner on a Saturday right before a game. The wait wasn't too long and the pizza was also pretty quick to come out. I tried the Amici's Combo and Spicy Pepper Chicken. You can't go wrong with Amici's Combo (meat + mushrooms + olives) but I wasn't too fond of the Spicy Pepper Chicken. I am not a big fan of chicken on my pizza and this chicken was a bit dry. Service was still great considering how busy the restaurant was.
author: Maya S.

description:
I had Amici's pizza several times over the weekend because it's convenient and it's something that can be easily served to a group of workers at a job site.  Since we were just working a block away we'd call in our large order and just walk over to pick it up.

The young ladies working at the cash register were super cheerful and super polite.  Even though the restaurant was super busy our order was ready and waiting for us at exactly the time that the order taker had stated.  They had no problem with a last minute request for plates, napkins and lots of cheese and peppers.

I'll be honest; I'm not a big fan of their pizza however.  The crust is super thin but the bottom crust is almost always burnt black.  I checked each pie and that was the case on all of them.  There is barely cheese on the top and the regular toppings are usually pretty sparse.  The red sauce is not very tomatoey and it does have a little sort of spicy kick to it.  Overall the pizza is quite salty too, but when you're working out of AT&T Park you can't beat Amici's for the overall convenience factor.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: We had 2 pizzas (1 med, 1 small) and a salad delivered for dinner on Friday.  Total cost was $65, which seemed like a lot.  The pizza was completely average - nothing special, the crust was a little burnt - and we paid a big premium.  Shame on me for not doing more research in advance - I won't be back for this overpriced average experience, and recommend others to look for better values in this city full of great options.
author: Jason K.

description: I will never order delivery from Paxtis again. This pizza is delicious and they delivered it to our house in 35 minutes!  Don't buy into the foodie hype around these newer pizza shops with 2 hour delivery windows. Amici's is the way to go.
author: Rebecca W.

description:
I live in Potrero Hill - 7 minutes from the King street location - and they won't deliver to my house. They will, however, deliver to most of the Mission & all of Noe/Castro. 

This is totally unacceptable red-lining and discriminatory. I can't believe the owners of this chain tolerate such practices. 

I will also be filing complaints with the city.
author: thomas g.

description:
Service has been excellent every time we go.  Had issues with our salad & got a voucher for a free large pizza.  We brought our 6 month old baby & the server was extremely friendly & welcoming to him.

Never had to wait for a table, price is good.

Food is as expected for a chain.
author: ana w.

description:
Mediocre, bland, tasteless.  And burned.  No, I'm not talking about the box, but the actual pizza.  Thank goodness it was free (company function).

The one entree I had here was also unremarkable.  Come to think of it, that one was free too.  Why?  The boss likes Amici's!  Go figure.

I suppose if this were the only place open, or if the food was free, that I might give it another shot.
author: dan s.

description: if you like orange grease running down your arm with every bite then this is the place for you. Charges us for a bowl of Pasta $12.50 that we didn't order.
author: David G.

description:
Good place to grab a bite to eat before heading to AT&T Park because it is literally across the street. 

They have outdoor seating for the beautiful summer days in the city. The day we went it was actually really hot and I had to find some shade! I know this place is known for their pizzas but the bf and I ordered penne with meat sauce (small order) and a meatball parmesan sub to share instead. 

The service isn't the best here. Our waitress was nice but we hardly saw her and we waited a really long time to get our check after we were done eating...which was annoying because we were in a hurry to get to the Giants game! 

Anyhow, back to the food. I like that you have the option of choosing different sizes of the pasta dishes because there are some days when you feel like being a fatty and others when you don't. The pasta dish was nothing special but I did like that the pasta was a perfectly cooked al dente.  The bf and I both had a half of the meatball sub. My only complaint about that was that a part of the bread was so burnt that it was totally inedible and I had to eat around the burnt areas.

You definitely get more bang for your buck here compared to eating at the ballpark.
author: Patricia L.

description: Wow. These guys refuse to deliver to Dogpatch, even though it's quite close.
author: Holly T.

description:
Another great place in walking distance from my work.  When you first walk up you notice they have great outdoor seating right across from the stadum.  Check the baseball schedule, cause you dont even wanna try and get in here on a game day.

I love the breadsticks here, but go for the plain ones, the garlic ones are just so so  and not worth the extra charge.  Get the ranch suace to go with them, it reminds me of the breadsticks I would get at the yummy pizza places in college....god bless gumby's.

I Luuuuv the fact that you can create your own pizza, I always order a spincach and feta mini, it is the BOMB!

Still feeling hungry?  Get a side garden sald, it is the perfect portion and will make  you feel like you ate something healthy after you OD on carbs!
author: Alicia K.

description:
This pizza is a-ok, only because it is suuuupppper greasy and expensive.
for a seven inch pizza which is about four slices i paid 10 bucks! smh @self, i fig i would get more bang for my buck, but i guess not.
author: Shante E.

description:
Late one Saturday I got the munchies after drinking too much, so we placed an order to Amici's for the first time ever.  I was wary since the reviews seemed a little mixed, but my stomach was not to be denied.

It was after 10 when the order was placed, but they had it up to us pretty quickly.  The delivery guy was nice and apparently had no trouble navigating his way around the condo I was staying at. 

When we opened the pizza box, oh it smelled divine.  We got a large create your own pizza with a bunch of random toppings.  I was THRILLED that they offer broccoli as a topping...sooo good on pizza!  Let me tell you, that pizza from Amici's was DAMN good.  It was fresh, hot, and weighted down with all those toppings.  They were not stingy with the cheese, either. 

I'd order from here again in a heartbeat.  Oh, and the crust wasn't overcooked at all.  From the other reviews, I'd say your mileage may vary.
author: Ashley R.

description:
Our pizzas were overcooked, sparse on toppings, and just not that good. And to top it all off, the pizza was super expensive. Not worth it. 

They get an extra star because the delivery was super fast (less than 30 minutes).  Otherwise the food only deserves one star.
author: Michael M.

description: Came here with my Uncle to Amici's East Coast Pizzeria for dinner on a Saturday night after seeing another SF Giants Night Game and to see Matt Cain lose another game and this time it was against the Hated Los Angeles Dodgers... Anyways that doesnt matter to me whether they win or lose, I just like coming to the SF Giants Games just to have fun and to enjoy the awesome view of the San Francisco Bay!!! Okay enough with this what I ate at Amici's was the Amici's Combo which had Pepperoni, Meatball, Bacon, Sauteed Mushrooms, Black Olives which was the first time that have eaten this pizza which tasted really goooood!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I came here for lunch once but this was my first time for me and my Uncle that we both have eaten here for dinner at Amici's East Coast Pizzeria near by to AT&T Park!!!
author: William B.

description: The Spicy Pepper Chicken dish was delish! It was a little burnt and inconsistent with the one I had at a different location but it was still a tasty pizza. Don't forget to order it with tomato sauce since it doesnt come with any...makes ALL the difference in the world!
author: Angela P.

description: We had this pizza for company meeting today, and it was so good I totally missed out on what happened during the meeting. It's very tasty, I don't understand why it didn't get better ratings on here. The Cheese Pizza is yummy!
author: Song Z.

description: Coming here a few times Amici's is just ok. I think its a bit overpriced for what it is. I get that its supposed to be fancy pizza, but its just regular pizza to me. The food is good but i've always felt like I could get better pizza for much  cheaper elsewhere. I have had some of their pasta and its pretty decent. I just think this place is too hyped up and expensive for just some small portioned pizza.
author: Rehana K.

description:
I've long been a fan of Amici's. Now, I'm not going to claim that they make the best pizza I've ever had (I make that!) but they offer a consistent product and good service. I nearly always get the Trentino. 

I cannot evaluate Amici's claim to authenticity on the East Coast as I have never had pizza from that region. But I can say that they don't overload their pizzas with toppings, a common downfall of lesser pizza joints, and I fully believe that the crust makes the pizza, and a real open flamed brick oven makes the crust. You can't quite replicate it in other pizza ovens. 

Finally, the convenience of Amici's is hard to beat. The prices are competitive with other good pizza joints and the free delivery is a huge plus. They also have a good number of restaurants without turning into a TGIFridays or anything. 

My only gripe with this particular restaurant is that, despite being within spitting distance to ATT Park, they don't have even one tv on which to show the game.
author: Scott C.

description:
I moved here from NYC and have been looking for some tasty thin crust pizza. Let me say, it was delicious! It wasn't greasy, it was so thin and perfectly crispy. I got the plain cheese 13" and wish I could eat it forever. 

I will be going back!
author: Laurence S.

description: Went over there before the Giants game and sat down for a quick meal. Turns out, the mini pizza is really mini and it was $12.95. We ordered 3 mini pizza and a glass of white wine. When the bill came, I noticed a $4.85 surcharge !!  Surprised that the restaurant charged that ~ ( That is  on top of the 15% tip we gave. )  The pizza were ok, not the best. So I'm sure we won't go back again.
author: Annie G.

description:
We order from this place weekly via waiter.com and the pizza is always outstanding. It's like a slice of New York City without all that pesky snow.

This place is 5 stars on its own, but deserves 5 more stars for having Daiya vegan cheese on the menu and offering it to customers without that unfair vegan tax. (in other words: substitute vegan cheese on your pizza for FREE--- try it! you'll love it! i swear!)

ProTip: ask for pizza sauce instead of marinara for the bread sticks, because their pizza sauce is amazing. the bread sticks are also amazing.

Bonus ProTip: try the roasted Yukon gold potatoes on pizza. it's weird, but delicious.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Good pizza, very consistent with each order.  We also got delivery once and the delivery person came right on time and was very courteous.

My only criticism is that it doesn't seem like a good value for the money.  I'm not looking for Pizza Hut prices, but it just seems a little steep to get a large thin pizza with 8 slices that takes 5-10 minutes to bake for $30.  I feel like I could get a stuffed deep dish pizza from one of SF's other pizzerias for less than that.  Oh well.
author: Jon S.

description: It was my first time here. We stopped in around 6:00 right before heading to the giants game. Seated right away. Me and a friend shared a Margherita pizza and an order of breadsticks. The small pizza was enough to fill up both of us without us having to be rolled out of the restaurant. Another friend ordered the large ravioli and when it came out there was nothing large about it.... i would not have paid the $15 he did for that plate of pasta. Pitchers of beers run about $14 here, and they have a decent selection. The waiter was very nice and quick. Might go back, but it wouldn't be my first choice.
author: Nicolette C.

description: This rating is for the vegetarian pizza since its the only thing I tried. I had it for take out. It was amazing! Very fresh ingredients. The crust was a perfect balance between crisp and soft. The cheese combination was so good too!
author: Kassandra Z.

description: No locations of amici's deliver to bernal heights.  unacceptable!!  this is really no stars.
author: Carolyn B.

description: We finally tried this place out for delivery & it was delicious!  We got the large spicy pepper chicken pizza  and an order of Gnocchi with Butter and Parmesan.  I always watch how many slices I eat but we ended up eating the entire pie in one sitting...it was a large...there were no left-overs...there was only 2 of us.  It was great!  We are fans!  As for the delivery, it came early and the person was very friendly.  Yum, just YUM!
author: Donna W.

description:
This is vegan review, for other vegan folks comparing your pizza options in the Bay Area.  I'm working my way through all the places slowly but surely....

I've only had take out from here, so I can't comment on the ambiance of the establishment... but  we called in an order upon leaving SFO and stopped for curb-side pick up.  The pizza was ready by the time we got there, and they kindly brought it out to us in the pouring rain.

Best vegan pizza I've had in the Bay Area, so far.  The crust is really great; the sauce is delish; they use Daiya cheese (which melts!) AND they don't charge extra for it now.  We also got a panzanella salad, which was pretty good but not great.  The total price seemed a bit high, but I think that's because we ordered a medium with several deluxe toppings that jacked the price up quickly plus the salad.  Next time I would just go for a large or extra large with a couple simple toppings and skip the salad.   I can't wait until the next time I fly into SFO again! Will definitely make a stop for this pizza.
author: Jen F.

description: This pizza place was awesome and convenient.  On my way to the Giants Baseball game, I stopped in here with my son. We ordered the Amici's Combo. Again, it was great. Loved the good fast service.
author: Patrick Z.

description:
Ok, any Giants fan has heard the radio hype. I've gone to Amici's probably two handfuls of times over the last 15 years, mostly on Union Street. I moved into the South Beach area over the summer and have had 3 experiences at the King Street location. 
Here's my take:
game day crowds throw this location for a loop, they can't handle it.
During road games, there is NO TV. This place has huge placement on Giants radio, it is RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET FROM ATT PARK and has NO TV??? HELLO?!! I'll go to Pete's, Pedro's the Public House or any other place on King Street, 2nd, Townsend, etc. 
I walked over last week, had a small pizza, side salad and 1 beer and dropped over $30? I like the pizza and the location, but that is bad value. I doubt I'll go back until they add some flat screens and drop the price at least during the off-season.
author: Lefty R.

description: What's not to like?  Fresh and tasty although during my last visit the crust was burnt but the waiter was kind enough to make it right.  Love to go there before a Giants game.  I think I like the simple cheese with basil and all it's all good.
author: kathy p.

description:
Meh. I've had better Amici's service and better tasting food at other Amici location.

Fettuccine Alfredo - the pasta was not al dente and the sauce didn't taste very good. 

Still love the Cesar salad here.
author: Jboogie L.

description: It actually makes me sad that this place exists.  The pizza is just terrible.  I am from New Haven and grew up on that style of pizza, so it's not just an expectations thing.  And it's not a pizza snob thing either...I can easily think of a dozen places in SF that have better pizza than Amici's.  Actually to be honest Domino's is better than Amici's.  The slices have a rubbery texture and hardly any flavor, and the pizza's not cheap, either!
author: Alex H.

description: Made the mistake of ordering in to our hotel. Average pizza. Bad lasagna. Inedible meatballs. Highly recommend you skip this one.
author: Joe B.

description:
I came here after Oktoberfest and remember the pizza being expensive and only adequate. 

This wasn't my choice and I doubt I'll be back.
author: Manny F.

description:
I just moved here from NYC. Amici is right down the street from my apartment and pretty good. It loses points that make it NOT like east coast pizza because of the minimum delivery order being so high and it is rather pricey compared to good ol' NYC pies.

Pizza is good though and although I've only picked up, service was nice and fast!
author: Dalia M.

description:
I've been to Amici's many times because they're near my office. I've usually had good experiences with them, but last night's food delivery took them a big notch down for me. 

The lasagna was decent but the pepperoni pizza was overcooked, burned around the edges and very salty. In fact, it was horrible. Also, the garlic bread sticks didn't taste very much of garlic. I paid nearly $60 for the food (plus tip) and expected a lot better than what we got. I'm sorry to say that I probably won't order pizza from them again. Once bitten, twice shy.
author: Vincent P.

description: came here before the ball game and they had a special! 2 for $5 togo! so I did just that. They only have pepperoni or cheese flavors. It's no Costco size but it's decent. Really greasy and oily. More so than your average pizza. I had the pepperoni, it was extremely salty.... I've had their other pizza's before - and they weren't too bad (but it was at a different Amici's location)
author: Kristina L.

description: The service and pizza was great. The wait was a little long because of the baseball crowd. But the atmosphere was good and I will definitely come back again.
author: Denny G.

description: A bit pricey but what isnt in SF?  I've been a few times while visitng the ballpark nearby and sat inside and out.  Always have had good service and quick on event nights to get people in and out.  Pizzas, pastas and salads are all great sizes for sharing.  Whenever I eat here I never feel like I'm eating in a chain restaurant.  All the dishes are freshly prepared and the pizza has never been greasy like other chain pizza places.
author: Mary E.

description:
I was visiting family that lives close by, so we decided to have a casual dinner with everyone at Amici's. Our group was seated quickly (we had a party of 8) and the server was great throughout. I ordered a pepperoni pizza, others ordered pasta, salad and a different kind of pizza. 

My pizza came out a bit on the burnt side and with smaller pepperonis than what I'm used to. Since this pizza was NY style, it was thinner and crispy. The taste was good, but not the best NY style pizza I've had (Bronx Pizza in San Diego takes that award to date).

All in all, the experience was good, not great, but I find it difficult for anyone to screw up pizza.
author: Brian C.

description:
Went here with a friend / date for a quick, spontaneous bite to eat since it was close to the Caltrain station.

I was indecisive on what to get, but decided on the Trentino, a pizza with parmesan, mozzarella, feta, fresh garlic, spinach, pancetta, and lemon olive oil. Sounds good, huh? It was surprisingly bland, and pretty oily. My friend's pasta was really oily, too.

The server was nice, so I'll give them that! I just wasn't wowed by the food. It wasn't bad. It just wasn't good.
author: Chris C.

description: Simple words of wisdom from Cookie. Pay attention folks. You want east coast pizza? GO TO THE EAST COAST. Simple. None of these so called west coast pizzarias including Amici can make an east coast pizza. Time for Cookie to hop on Jetblue to go to new york. Cookie just hopes there's no crazy pilot on board.
author: Cookie I.

description: I love their pizza.  Seriously, this is the only place in SF that makes East Coast pizza right.  My son also loves their New York pizza.  My fav is the Boston.
author: Aban E.

description:
3.5 stars actually, but I'm rounding down.

I was completely hungover one Saturday, and since venturing outside my apartment was too big of a chore for me, I decided to look for a really, really good thin-crust pizza.  Not like Pizza Orgasmica cornmeal crust (which, by the way, is awesome).  I'm talking about really crispy, kind of burnt, super thin crust.

I've seen a couple of Amici's delivery cars around my building, so I decided to look it up and try it.  After registering for an account on waiter.com (I wish they'd just have their own online ordering system like Extreme or Chico's), I ordered a thin-crust pepperoni pizza, garlic breadsticks and minestrone soup.  For delivery, I clicked the "deliver at 8 PM" on the drop-down menu, since it was only 4:00 in the afternoon and I wanted a few more hours for the hangover to clear.

At 4:45, the doorbell rang, and it was the Amici's delivery guy.  Puzzled, I told him that my order wasn't supposed to arrive until 8.  He looked at the receipt, called the restaurant, and apologized for the pizza.  Not wanting to make a big deal of it, I just took it and saved the breadsticks for the next day.  I wasn't that hungry yet, but the minestrone soup was delicious, and just a cup of it made me full enough to only have one slice of pizza.

The pizza is eh.  I loved the thin-crust, but there was something about the cheese and the little baby pepperonis that just didn't quite add up in my head.  Since I ate most of it the next day and it just wasn't the type of pizza that you eat cold, I'm sure that's a reason why I'm rounding down.

Garlic breadsticks were good, but not garlicky enough.  Again, I'm sure it would've tasted better hot, but they satisfied my carb cravings.

The other factor in rounding down was for them not checking the delivery time.  Thanks, I appreciate the efficiency, but there's a HUGE DIFFERENCE between getting your dinner at 5 PM, and getting it at 8 PM.
author: Tori S.

description:
Way too much money for a burned pizza.

The service was alright, but I'm pretty sure pizza crust is not supposed to be black.

WAY overpriced, almost $90.00 for what should have been about half the price.

Not real impressed!
author: Jackson K.

description:
Vegans: Amici now uses Daiya  cheese. Two large vegan pizzas will fill a family of four, with leftovers. Parking is tough and the parking garage behind it is pricey, even with the "20 minute" discount from Amici's. But the pizzas are really good and a welcome change from some of the mediocre soy cheeses out there, or having to order a cheese-less pizza. Daiya really changes everything.

Giants fans: Come extra early, order a large pizza and a couple of Sierra Nevadas, and take in the game at the greatest ballpark in America across the street. Don't expect Barry Zito to come through, but you can't beat the venue and the pizza is delicious.
author: Nathan W.

description:
They switched their vegan cheese to Daiya!  :(  I know everyone else seems to think that Daiya is God's gift to vegans, but I think it is too slimey and has kind of an off taste.  Cheezly was so much better!

That said, it's still really encouraging that they are offering vegan cheese, and it's awesome that more pizza places are getting on board.  So I can't make this review any lower than four stars, even though I probably won't be ordering a pizza from here again - because I got to rep the vegan-ness, and also because the change to Daiya might be considered a GOOD thing to other people.  But for me, I wish they hadn't gotten rid of my sweet sweet Cheezly!  *pouts*
author: Ashley B.

description:
I LOVE their pizza! I'm from NY and the pies here are exactly like the pies from home. Their crust is so thin!!! I love it! They have vegan cheese (Daiya)! However, they don't have any vegan meats! It definitely feels like you are missing a topping without a protein substitute.

They deliver as far as the Castro!

Their pizza is definitely the best pizza I've had in SF so far! And it's not because of the vegan cheese!
author: Philip R.

description:
I typically don't review pizza places but Amici's is a big fat expensive MEH.

We order Amici's for our evening classes sometimes and the bill always comes out to be crazy expensive.  $225+ for 4 pizzas, 2 salads, and some sodas.  A $12 pasta is basically the size of an appetizer/side.

I do like their Milano pizza with the potatoes and bacon, and eating thin crust does make me feel like less of a fatty.  But if I'm gonna order pizza, I'd rather go with a cheap and filling place.
author: S L.

description: Ate here right before a game. Great pizza and atmosphere! love the thin crust and crunchiness of it.
author: Roy S.

description:
So awful...well actually the pizza was pretty good but I got food poisoning. How do I know for sure? Everybody I was with also got diarrhea.

I called to let them know. Secretly, I expected a credit but no, nothing. I'm never going back. Plenty of other pizza places south of Market.
author: Tracy Y.

description:
You get what you know you'd get.  

Tasty Pizza, Tasty Pasta, okay service, and a just a tiny bit overpriced for the quality of food - but comparable to SOMA.

Had the pesto Pasta which was flavorful and great.  And the amici's topping pizza - which was tasty.  

Came out to 30ish.  

If you are feeling italian at a casual place, Amici does the job well.
author: Andy G.

description:
Amici's wasn't the place to be for lunch last Friday. Our party of eight arrived at noon to the restaurant. We were greeted by an unoccupied hostess stand and an almost empty restaurant; they were not busy yet from the usual lunch rush experienced by most restaurants. With these conditions, one would think it would be easy to obtain a table fairly quickly? Right? Wrong. We were left standing at the hostess stand for eight minutes before being seated. During that time, we didn't know if the restaurant could accommodate our party (despite being empty) or if we should just seat ourselves. 

When we were finally seated, we were placed next to the entrance. This was not good as it was an extremely cold winter day. Our group had the cold frosty wind blown on us throughout the meal. Not cool. Usually, I would have requested another section, however, I was a guest for this event.  

While reviewing the menu, I felt that everything was overpriced. My Fettucini Alfredo order was bland and disappointing. The Fettucini Alfredo barely had any cheese and the white sauce tasted like flour. This was my first experience at Amici's. I will not return to this establishment.
author: Sarita S.

description:
2.5 stars.

Finding a decent slice in San Francisco has been a greater challenge than I thought.  Finding a place that delivers a decent slice...impossible.

I have ordered from Amici's more than once--the pizza is just "ok".  It is no way authentic east coast pizza (I am from the east coast), but it is better than the others I have tried in the neighborhood.  Piccino's in nearby Dogpatch is far better...but they don't deliver.  =(

High marks for their ceasar salad dressing, yes, the dressing specifically.  The salad itself is standard fare and nothing that will knock your socks off.  That dressing though is awesome.

I ordered a pasta dish once (penne with putanesca sauce), and it was absolutely inedible.  After 2 bites, it had to be tossed.

Stick with the basic pizza pies and give that ceasar salad a try.
author: Jen Y.

description: The pizza from Amici's is okay, nothing special. However, they stopped delivering to most of Potrero Hill because they had a few drivers held up several years ago. I sympathize, but perhaps you could do some research on which streets to avoid rather than banning the bulk of the neighborhood. Also, how is it that Goat Hill and some Mission pizzerias have no issue? Maybe if you didn't emblazon your delivery vehicles with a sign advertising the chain, it would be safer for your drivers?
author: Daniel Q.

description:
Was jonesing for some pizza on a sunday afternoon, so I looked up Amici's, since it's close by and I've heard good things about it as being a top NY-style pizza in town.

Went online and placed my order.  Everything is through waiter.com, which is OK.  I ordered a medium pie with extra mozzarella, pepperoni, green peppers, roasted garlic and carmelized onions.  Total price was $22.05, plus 4.85% healthcare fee + tax.

The good:
1) Pizza was very tasty.  Definitely NY style and likely some of the best I've had in town.
2) Delivery.  Earlier than they promised (said 45 minutes but did it in 28).

The "just OK"
1) Toppings were sparse.  I expected more green pepper and onions.

The bad
1) They not only taxed my pizza, they also taxed my 4.85% healthcare fee contribution they require.  Charging a tax on a tax isn't good and may be illegal.  (I did the math on this to triple check)
2) The price is high!  $22 for a medium pizza is expensive!!

I enjoyed the pizza a lot, but I don't think it was worth the price.
author: Todd M.

description:
Different location, same sad story.

Amici's used to have delicious vegan pizza with the amazingly flavorful Cheezly. Unfortunately, they have switched to Daiya -- the latest craze of the vegan cheese world. Despite the raving reviews, Daiya does not begin to compare to Cheezly when it comes to flavor -- which is where it counts!!

Daiya tastes like Kraft singles. Imagine a pizza with Kraft singles. Gross.

I really hope they change back. I just ordered chinese delivery, but I wish it could have been cheezly pizza.
author: Alex F.

description:
I came here the day after the Giants parade and was dying of hunger. Luckily the wait wasn't too long. Sat down had my beverage refilled at least once and the pizza came after about 10 minutes or so. I'm guessing, I didn't know how long the actual time was.

Margarita pizza is the pizza of my choice with fresh garlic and tomato sauce. In and out in under an hour for a busy day. I'll always come back for pizza from this place. Never a bad pizza.
author: Jen C.

description:
This location of Amici's is right by AT&T park. Therefore, the place is hoppin on nights when there are giants games.  We actually came here right before a game ended and avoided too much of a wait. 

The pizza is NY style, thin crust.  You can specify the size, we ordered a large since it was 3 folks eating.  As for the taste, it's pretty good for SF.  Not the best, but acceptable for being made with cali water.   Pricing is moderate, especially when pizza is shared.  You can opt to dine in (they have ample seating) or have it for take out/delivered.
author: Ka C.

description:
I can't tell you how much fun we had today at Amici's. The place was packed with Giants Fans but we could not tell by the great service. We had a nice corner table with the warm winter sun beaming in. We had the half order antipasto. Plenty for two and Very fresh and crisp. Followed by the Amici's Combo Pizza. Wonder full crisp slightly burnt crust and not that yukky thick tomato sauce that usually covers the flavors of the pizza ingredients.
All in all a wonderful time in the midst of Orange October.
author: Geoff F.

description: Joined a long-time New Haven friend for informal early dinner with her dad visiting from NY state, all of us discerning, picky pizza eaters--the place did not disappoint, and the service was fantastic.  We each had salads--all really nicely prepared with freshly cut red onion, aromatic olive oil etc, and then each had different pizzas--liked mine the best --Sicilian so called with broccoli and Ital sausage--cooked well and not at all greasy.  Re several of the Yelp reviews that refer to burnt pies, none of ours were at all burnt, but even if they were, we all know that with hot ovens,  the crust sometimes get burnt, that's what a Frank Pepe pie (New Haven) is all about...
author: Jack G.

description:
I can't rate the Pizza or the delivery service.

I ordered take out. Our order was:

Cheese Ravioli 
Side of pesto gnocci 
Eggplant pasta bake
Spinach salad sans the bacon
One slice of cheesecake to complete the fatty buffet

I'd give them 4 stars, but the price vs what you get.. it doesn't add up to a good value.
The gnocchi was good but they should stress that the "side" is about 3 bites of gnocchi. The pesto was a little lump on top of the gnocchi with the oil pooled at the bottom. 

Everything else was pretty good but nothing was exceptionally good.

I don't have anything witty to say this time. bummer.
author: Amber F.

description: what a disappointment.  Lasagna with meat sauce was really no better than Stouffers.  The 4,95 beer was not a pub pint (it was only 16 ounces as opposed to 20).  The waitress rolled her eyes, when in answer to her asking if I'd like another beer, I replied that, no, I only get one.  20 bucks...I could have made better at home.  Won't be back.
author: Unemployed D.

description: Not bad option if you are looking for pizza delivery in the city. i can't say the pizza here blew me away, but I definitely enjoyed it. I do think they could do a better job cooking the curst (that goes for the bottom of the pizza too) but it didn't hamper the overall product that much. It's a step above delivery chains but not quite willing to give it a fourth star here
author: Taylor C.

description: Linguini with clams in red sauce. One of the better places for this dish! The service is decent here and unlike the other location, there isn't a drugged up person peeing in the bathroom trash can. This place is pretty decent.
author: Eva Y.

description:
I had their vegan pizza with soy mozzarella. Pretty good for vegan cheese. Make sure you get some extra toppings.

The service is very fast and it's a nice place to sit down and eat.
author: saurabh S.

description:
4 star pizza -1 star for taking forever to deliver.  They have pick up orders ready in like 7 minutes no joke... but if they deliver its as if they have to travel from 50 miles away to get to you!


If you are local just order a pickup and save yourself the headache of waiting.  

The pizza itself is delicious. no complaints there.  I love their spicy chicken and their pep.
author: Shawn A.

description:
On a quest to finding the best pizza delivery in my new neighborhood, i ordered from Amici's!.. I heard people say it is the best pizza in town and had to try it and i think i have found it!

Quick delivery!= 30 minutes.
Tasty pizza!= ordered medium veggie w/ peperoni, half antipasto salad and drinks and fought for the last slice! ha! 
Pizza was very good, thin crust, well cooked and it came with generous small cups of parmesan and red pepper flakes.
Salad was also really good!!
I will definitely order from them again. 
Finally i found a pizza delivery that i like!! 5*s!=)
author: C A.

description:
Awful service and extremely rude.

Avoid at all cost before and after Giants games.  The service is extremely slow and the pasta that we ordered was cold and they delivered  a small plate when we ordered a large plate.

The pizza was really greasy and the crust was soggy.

I live on Potrero Hill and have been here at other times, as well and the quality is inconsistent even when there isn't a Giants game.  

There are so many more great pizza places in the City.  Don't waste your money or your time here.  I do not recommend this.
author: Erik T.

description:
I'm not sure if they've changed management, but lately, the quality control has gone down exponentially!  

Of the last 10 times we've ordered from here, they've screwed up the order in one way or another.  Either they delivered the wrong pizza all together, or the crust is burnt to an inedible state or the pizza was dropped during the delivery.  

I mean, how could someone deliver a pizza knowing full well that it's been dropped and the chances of it being mangled to a pulp is about 100%, drop off a pizza with a smile as we sign for it at the door?  I mean really, WTF!!??!!!  

What made things worse is, we called the restaurant and the manager literally asked... What's wrong this time?  Well, Mr. Manager... what's wrong is your driver F'd up and didn't fess up!  Oh... and Mr. Manager, that... "this time" should be a key indication of your poorly managed establishment, QA has gone down.  WAY DOWN!

It's too bad because this is one of our favorite places to order from for delivery.  Actually, it's the ONLY place we order from.  But, if we're going to pay 60 bucks for shitty mal-formed pizza, I'll pass and would gladly go to one of the neighbor hood pizza joints that don't deliver.
author: Delilah B.

description: So... I have never eaten at Amici's but this is the site that delivers to my place.  I love the pizza from here.  Usually order to arrival is under an hour.  I usually get a large pizza and large Caesar salad without anchovies.  Yes, it is pricey but so are most tasty things in SF.  If you buy cheaper pizza, you will get cheaper quality and not as tasty.  I love that they saute their ingredients so all the items are cooked.  I'm a spinach, tomato, mushroom, and pepperoni person.  This combo usually makes a pizza soggy but Amici's pizza has never been delievered that way.  Caesar salad is always fresh.  The salad dressing is on the side and not just a plain "out of bottle" dressing.
author: Soo C.

description:
Amici's is a nice way to start off an evening at a Giants game. Luckily, we got a table right away, while most of the other people were at the ballpark still getting their free Giants' blanket.

Split a small pizza, half Trentino and half Pollo.  The Trentino, with its red onions, herbs and Italian bacon (mmm bacon), tasted a lot better than the sort of bland Pollo. Although, I did like the roasted garlic cloves on the Pollo. 

The pizza is actually pretty good with no tomato sauce. We got some tomato sauce on the side, but I really didn't need it because it wasn't all that great.

Since, garlic seemed to be the theme of the night, we got some garlic sauce for the pizza, on the side.

Whew, you know it's a night of good eats when you have baby spinach stuck in your teeth and your breath can kill the undead.
author: Sam T.

description:
Shatangi is a pizza fanatic. That said, Amici's is an OK pie. The crust is always burnt and the slices tend to be overly greasy but the service is top notch both for dining room and delivery. 

Shatangi told you...
author: Njon W.

description:
This place makes some good pizza, definitely more like that of New Haven, though it is similar to a new york style in its thinness.
(See Avery G's review--he knows his shit)

I must say, though, that arinell's is better.  Amici's is good--BE SURE TO ASK FOR EXTRA THIN.  The crust does pretty well mostly in keeping its shape after you fold it, so it gets thumbs up from me.

The cheese-to-sauce-to-crust ratio was pretty good for a NY/New Haven type pizza.  I'd have to say, though, that the toppings were a little lacking in quantity.  I know, I shoulda just gotten cheese, but I didn't know if they were good til just now.  The Philly is what I got, and it was decent.

Delivery service was prompt, less than 30 minutes delivery to my office here in SOMA/FiDi.  And they take my corporate AmEx!  sweet!

My only complaint:  price.  $25 for a large that wasn't as large as a true NY large.  That's a LOT.  If it were more affordable, amici's would definitely get 5 stars.
author: Fong L.

description:
I think this is definitely the best East Coast Pizza in SF.  It still leaves a lot to be desired, but definitely my favorite.  The crust is *ALMOST* right.  If they didn't do the nouvelle burning in the wood ovens it would be far better.

They have some funky toppings you'd never see in a Manhattan or Jersey pizzeria....eggplant? caramelized onions? soy mozzarella?  But  some of them are pretty tasty...the manhattan red clam has become a favorite.

They slice their sausage nice and thin, unlike so many SF places that crumble it and dump it on, the sauce could use a little spicing up but they get the right ratio of cheese to sauce and the grease factor is dead on.

But I just can't give it higher than 3 stars because of the prices.  I got a large two topping and a half-antipasto salad...which is just some iceberg lettuce with a few measly slices of salami and some pepperoncini, and it came out to $32...and I picked it up!  For delivery it comes to almost $40 with tip.  That's just ridiculous.

But I still have their number in my speed dial.  With half of one of these greasy babies in my belly I slip into a nice food coma, and manage to sleep, perchance to dream of my next trip to NY.
author: Jay W.

description:
I ate lunch here yesterday and it was fantastic. I had eaten here 5 weeks ago with a boy who was moving to SOMA.  As soon as we shared the pepperoni pizza in August, we began the countdown until we could eat it again.  Last week, he drove his car over from Atlanta, and throughout the trip, the pizza kept coming up in our conversations.  

I love anticipation, don't you?

Anyway, we ate here yesterday for lunch and it was just like I remembered.  Well, I was five pounds heavier, but at least the food was the same.  If not better. 

This time (because of the five pounds) I ordered tomatoes on my half.  They asked us if we wanted fresh garlic.. (heck yes). 

The thin crust was great, because it allowed me to eat 3 pieces and not feel too guilty.  

I also had a salad with the fat-free tomato vinagrette.. This sounds dumb, but I was surprised at the thick tomato base.  Strangely appetizing, though, so I will order it again.  

If you're on a date, you may want to order the salad to appear feminine;  If you're already married to the guy, forego the salad and attack the pizza. 

Medium is enough for two people.  If you're taking it home to eat it by yourself, a la Bridget Jones, I recommend the small :o)
author: Janney B.

description:
Amici's makes an ok thin crust pizza.  Cooked at high temperatures (almost 750F), their pies take only a few minutes to bake and have a great texture--slightly charred on the outside and chewy on the inside. 

I wasn't impressed with the toppings here.  Most of the vegetable toppings here are cooked and end up tasting quite soggy.  No good.

While I really enjoy the pizzas at Amici's, I find them to be ridiculously overpriced and not very filling.  A personal pizza with  toppings can break the ten dollar mark.  A large cheese pizza is just shy of $18.  

Avoid the salads at all costs... especially the Caesar.  It's basically a house salad served with sub-par Caesar dressing.
author: Dheeraj I.

description:
I really like the pizza at Amici's. I think they have some great combinations and I like the thin crust, cause you don't get soo full!!
I do think the prices on the pasta are a bit high, but they are tasty!!
Pretty fast delivery, too!!
author: Lisa A.

description:
Whoever added the "east coast pizzeria" to their name should be slapped.

This is the kind of place uppity ups go to in order to spend far too much money on bland pizza that they'll eat with a knife and fork.  Burnt crust, super greasy, tasteless.

There's a little joint just around the corner on 2rd Street that serves bigger and better slices for much cheaper.  If you crave pizza before the game, go there instead.  You could buy another couple of beers with the money you'll save.
author: Max F.

description:
I can't think of a better way to have ended my Saturday.

The girlfriend and I had spent a wonderful yet tiring day strolling North Beach, dining at a cafe, enjoying the scenery while laying on the grass ata nearby park, and taking multiple busses to get to Caltrain in SoMa so she might get home safe that night.

Having just missed the previous train, and once again hungry from our trek, we were in search of something to eat. Stumbling upon Amici's we decided to give t a go. With about 40 minutes until her train left, time was a factor.

As soon as we arrived we were seated, admiring the brick decor (and tolerating the Yankee displays surrounding me.) I felt comfortable, reminded of my beloved Bertucci's back home.

We each ordered a glass of the house white, and it was before us a few minutes later. Upon makng our decision for the artichoke pizza, our waitress was quickly upon us, and our pizza merely moments later. We were not disappointed.

The best thing was, we enver felt rushed or pushed. We needed drink, it was there. We needed food, it came soon as well. We never mentioned we were in a hurry, and because the staff acted so swiftly we were able to relax and enjoy ourselves. Maybe they tapped into some of that Comcast high speed. It was eerie.

The food was good, the price was decent and service was impressive. I'd definately come back again.
author: Keith M.

description:
This review is based on a crowded day, Tuesday 6/17 (Giants Game, NBA FInals Game 6, around 6:30ish).
