description: the food was great. i had the cheese ravioli with pesto and loved it. the service was great. after we were finished we were halfway down the street when we noticed we forgot our bread sticks that we were taking to go. When we went back they had already cleaned the table but they made us a new batch without hesitation. =)
author: Anthony H.

description: Awful. We ordered four large pizzas today, which came to a total of over $100. The price originally didn't bother me  - like I've said in other reviews, I don't mind paying for really good food - but this was the worst pizza I've had in a long time. When we got the pizzas, they were all soggy and burnt. This pizza is definitely not worth the money... any of the big, crappy pizza chains can do better than this, and at a fraction of the cost. Avoid this place.
author: a a.

description: Solid pizza, nothing great. I would be curious about there pastas. Not anytime soon though.
author: Rahul T.

description: I have never actually been to the restaurant, so my experience is solely about the pie. Stephanie at work was kind enough to order Amicis' pizza for lunch today's. I was surprised by the delicious crust and toppings. Definitely a keeper.
author: Lucie T.

description: Decent for a chain restaurant.  The pasta is not very good, the thin crust pizza is okay.  I'd only recommend if you're starving and in the vicinity.
author: Dave L.

description: Didn't feel like cooking tonight, so I called Amici's on King Street (they're on my speed dial) right before I got into the elevator to the parking garage. I asked for a medium ham and pineapple (the usual, I said) and they kindly reminded me that I ordered a large last time (oh OK - change that order then, I said.) The order was ready by the time I drove there from 2nd Street. Fantastic. Pizza is pretty good although a little salty at times - thin crust, generous bits of topping. Service is also very friendly. I would have given them 4 stars but I took away a star because of the parking situation - or lack thereof. King Street is a very busy street, and if they are offering drive-by pick-ups, they should at least have a space handy for quick stops. Which they do, but it always seems to be occupied by one of their delivery cars. As it was, I had to let my partner out and drive around several blocks through rush hour traffic (again) while he picked-up the pizza.
author: Rey L.

description: I'm a fan of Amici's in general. Any place that does low carb crust without it tasting like shit is awesome. I grab lunch here every few weeks. We love the antipasto salad and a pizza made-up-combo. You really just need to order the small version of the antipasto if its just two.
author: David T.

description:
okay so this is good, basic new york style pizza (i get just cheese on top)...but THEN, if you order extra marinara sauce on the pizza AS WELL AS extra sauce on the side to dip your pizza in, it is GREAT pizza.  i am a HUGE pizza fan and get this almost once a week.  luv it!!!!!!!!!!!!!

p.s. servers are really nice and attentive like 95% of the time.
author: courtney o.

description: Fantastic pizza.  The only reason this restaurant gets 4 stars instead of 5 is the poor wine list.  I mean come on, this is San Francisco and the best wine they have on the list is BV Napa Valley.  You have to be kidding.  However, getting past the wine list the food is very good.  I have eaten at this location many times and had great service and quality food every time.  Most recently, I had the side salad and the Amicis combo pizza.  Great tasting and decent prices.  My most recent visit I had top notch wait service by Anabele.  She was very attentive and not over bothersome.  There are some occasions where the waiter or waitress will not give you enough time to take a bite while continually bothering you.  Anabele was EXCELLENT!  Good food and service often hard to find together anymore.
author: Dion G.

description: The crust is decent. The sauce would be good if it had any kind of flavor. The cheese tastes like butter, its gross, they dont use Grande Cheese like they do in Jersey/NYC area. I dont know how they can claim to be a "East Coast Pizzeria". Their garlic bread is strips of bread like what you see on the Pizza Hut commercials and WHERES THE GARLIC part of the  GARLIC bread!? Maybe they ran out of garlic, cause I didnt taste any. Way over priced for mediocre food. Maybe its because Im from Jersey that it tastes like crap to me. My girlfriend got a ceasar salad, she said the dressing was really salty and it had croutons so hard they could break teeth. Waste your money somewhere else.
author: Sean D.

description: I originally went with my family to the Amici's on Union Street but I stopped when they moved to Lombard.  For one the parking is much harder and also it has been invaded by the soccer mom's who refuse to control their children.  Luckily the location on King as kept a more adult feel and charm.  This chain of restaurants takes going out for pizza to a much higher level.  Everything there is delicious.  It is the only pizza place I go to and look forward to having a salad.  Everything there is so fresh and tasty.  My usually meal consists of a salad I share with who ever I am with, every dressing on the menu is good but my two favorites are the blue cheese and the sun-dried tomato.  Then either a full or half order of Garlic Breadsticks depending on the company and finished by a mini pizza.  I LOVE that they do the mini's, it is about the size of a large salad plat and just four slices.  This means everyone gets what they want, how perfect is that?  And I have to RAVE about the thin crust.  They are VERY generous with toping and don't over load it with the sauce.  I have to say, this is perhaps the best pizza in SF.  I wish there was one closer to my house so I could order from home, but I guess being close to work is better.
author: Amy P.

description: great food, best thing about this one is the SUPER fast delivery time if you live nearby!  :)
author: Deanna M.

description:
this is a very fair and objective review, after i ordered pizza for delivery willing to pay almost 30 bucks for a medium pizza i expected it to be close to perfect. wouldn't you? now i know that i recreate my own past experiences in a lot of my reviews but they are all true and verifiable, that being said i used to deliver pizzas in San leandro both when i was in high school and when i was in college. i used to park illegally and run up the stairs of some random apartment building in the hope of getting a tip. 
now, apparently the correct way to deliver is to call the person you're delivering to and make them come down and collect a tip. no more from this Gastric Castro. i have declared war on lazy delivery people that are middle eastern and can barely speak English in the first place. 
to me this Amicis is garbage. for the reasons listed above and because they spent a lot of money advertising on a radio station touting how good they were and how good they were at customer service. i waited 1 hour and 15 minutes for a cold pizza and when i called and complained i waited 30 minutes for a luke warm pizza. I will never order this pizza again; the customer service is disgusting. 
i would rather order a less expensive pizza that shows up on time or close to it. 
in my mind this is the worst experience that i have ever had with any delivery service since i have lived in sf, and that is saying a lot. i will never order from this place again. i suggest that if you really want to spend 30 bucks for a pizza save yourself a headache and pick-up pizza orgasmica or if you live in their delivery area get theirs. their cheaper, appreciate your business and the delivery personnel take the time to get out of their car and bring your food to your apartment like a delivery person is supposed to do. 
i really wish that i could get my 5 bucks back that i tipped that loser delivery fuck that brought my meal here tonight. i used to really like this place to. i guess it goes to show that when things start going "big" things start getting bad on the quality front.
author: Anthony Y.

description: amici's is my favorite pizza in town -- the margherita, with tomato sauce (they sprinkle it with fresh diced tomotoes too), is simple and perfect.  note:  amici's pizza is supposed to be well-done, and for me the more blackened on the bottom, the better.  amici's also makes a pretty good salad for a pizza place -- i always get the spinach with roasted roasted peppers, red onion, feta and pine nuts (fellow veggies and calorie counters: i order this without bacon, and with their nonfat sundried tomato dressing instead of the oil-based one it usu. comes with).  when we moved to a new place on a sketchy (sketchier) soma block, amici's at first refused to deliver to us after dark; we were heartbroken, but the pizza's so good that for months we picked our lazybones up off the couch and went and got it.  well, one thing a year's worth of gentrification means is that amici's delivers to us now, and, you know, i can't say i'm not pretty stoked about that.  and we've never waited more than 25 minutes for our delivery order, either at our old place at 2nd/folsom, or now that we live at 5th-ish/howard.
author: bug s.

description: awesome thin crust pizza that's for some reason is soo hard to find in San-Francisco! too bad they're a chain.
author: Prem M.
